story:
Hello!

My name is Darryl Daniels, I am twenty years old, and I have recently been accepted into Hillsong College in Australia to study music for three years. The doubt and lack of a financial supply had pushed my hopes of attending Hillsong to the back of my mind, and even caused me to almost give up that hope... Not anymore. But I need your help! I have applied and got accepted! Now I just need to pay.

The amount I need to raise is $7,500. This covers my flight, the first year’s tuition, and the three years that I will be staying there of Overseas Health Coverage, finalizing my acceptance. I will be working throughout the school year to pay for housing and living expenses.

Here's my story:

I was raised in a Christian home with two brothers and four sisters, me being the second youngest of the family. When I was thirteen my parents separated. This was a complete shock and it shook my world. The following year I had discovered that my dad’s body was slowly being taken over by pancreatic cancer.

August 27th, 2006, marks the day that I first experienced the loss of a loved one. My sister Nicole, at the age of 19, had passed away in a car accident due to impaired driving.
Two months after this, Oct. 31st, my dad passed away while he was in the hostpial getting treated for cancer. He had internel bleeding in his brain. I was there when his heart stopped beating.

Over the next few months it was as if a grey veil was pulled over my perspective of life. I fell into a deep depression. I felt alone and insignificant. I was only concerned about myself and could not see beyond my own pain.

One day I was alone in my room as thoughts of suicide were going through my mind when God pressed upon me to open my Bible and I decided to listen. I opened and read these words,


“He replied, ‘Because you have so little faith. Truly I tell you, if you have faith as small as a mustard seed, you can say to this mountain, "Move from here to there," and it will move. Nothing will be impossible for you.”


I flipped to another page and read,


“‘Have faith in God,’ Jesus answered.”


In that very moment an amazing peace suddenly came over me like a wave, washing away all of the weight that I had felt pressing me down, all the darkness that had been laid over my heart was gone.

I had never before felt the presence of God this way. It was thick and tangible; I felt covered and surrounded by love. I realized what it truly meant to know God; what it meant to have a relationship with Jesus Christ. Up to this point I had thought I understood what it meant to know God, but I learned otherwise.

Ever since that day I have not been the same. God had taken my life and restored it and given me a hope that can only be found in Jesus Christ. I have gone through ups and downs, but never have I fallen into depression like I once did. My oldest brother took his own life in January, 2009. This was another devastating event in the family. This time I did not focus on the situation around me, but up at God and He pulled me through. Without Jesus I would not be here and I owe Him my life. Now, I do the best I can to live for God and bring Him glory with everything I do.

My musical background:

I have been involved with music for 7 years now. I started off playing the drums and took private lessons for the first 4 years.

I eventually took music theory and picked up the piano, guitar, and singing. I have been playing guitar and singing for about 2 years now, as well as writing songs.

Through the years I have been playing the drums at churchs almost every Sunday morning and Wednesday night. I have also started singing lead every once in a while at church this past year.

Lately, I have been concentrating on singing and songwriting. Writing songs is a way for me to express myself in ways that I could not do otherwise.

My Dream:

With every song that I write I want God to be glorified; I want every word to point to Jesus Christ and His majesty. If there is any ability within me to do great things I want all of it to be used to lift up the name of God and point others to Him.

I believe the teaching, wisdom, and guidance that I will experience while attending Hillsong College will increase my ability to do this. By stretching and challenging me it will help me harness the potential and abilities that God has allowed me to have. Hillsong college is a christian college in Australia that I have been longing to go to, and I am no longer going to ignore what God has put on my heart, no matter the situations that I face. I will pursue the passion that God has placed inside of my heart!

Any funds exceeding the school payments will go towards the cost of me living in Australia until I am generating enough money to support myself, so every bit helps. 
 Even if you are unable to help support me financially, spreading the word and your prayers would be much appreciated. Thank you so much for taking the time to read my story!


Respectfully yours,

Darryl W. Daniels

story:
Here's the deal

Hey ya'll! My name is Paige Motz. I'm 19 years young and I am totally in love with Jesus Christ.

In May, I graduated from a 7 month school for missions in Brisbane, Australia. During the school, I also spent 7 weeks in Russia, living as a missionary. God completely changed my life during the Discipleship Training School in Australia and my outreach in Russia. I saw the hand of God move in AWESOME ways in the lives of people we were able to minister to, and through that, in my own life as well. God filled me up and so much growth took place in my life through Him! 

While I had my heart set on going to a university in Texas upon my return (and was already enrolled and everything!), I felt very strongly that the Lord was actually calling me BACK to Brisbane to staff the Music, Art, and Dance Discipleship Training School- where I could give of the overflow He has blessed me with, come alongside others and share all the things He has shown me, and even use my passion for photography to teach others how to use their art for God's glory as I help lead the photography track of the school. So at the beginning of August, I will head back to Australia to begin my 21 month commitment as a FULL TIME missionary with YWAM Bribane!

What I Need & What You Get

Because YWAM is completely volunteer-based, I am responsible for funding my trip, food and lodging, the Basic Leadership School course, and the 2 [missional] outreaches I will be leading. All prayers and support in this area would be greatly appreciated!

Over all, I will be needing around a total of $18,000 to cover all the things listed above, as well as my plane ticket, visa, overseas health care, and basic living necessitates.

I am currently working 3 jobs, have sold a good amount of my possessions, and am fundraising as much as possible to raise as much money as I can for this journey. However, with just ONE MONTH before I leave, I will need more than that to reach my goal.

I would appreciate your prayers and support SO much! And if you feel led or decide to donate financially, I'd like to give you a gift in return for your generosity! So check out the possible perks for your contribution on the side of this page :) 

 

The Impact

I am not merely taking part in this experience for myself or my own personal benefit. God totally transformed me during my DTS. Now, there's a passion stirring up in me to see the same thing happen in the lives that I get to be apart of while staffing! I want to use everything that God has shown me to benefit the lives of others for His glory. I want to be apart of others learning how God can use their art form- specifically photography- for HIS glory alone, and ultimately, I want to see Him touch lives in BIG ways. I truly believe God has big things for this generation, and is really moving on the mission field. And by supporting this cause- whether in prayer or financial donation- you could be a part of what God is doing there!

Other Ways You Can Help

One thing God has shown me recently is the POWER OF PRAYER. And I can confidently say that your prayers are worth just as much- if not MORE- than a monetary donation. So if you don't have the resources or feel led towards donating, no worries! I cannot beg you enough to support me in prayer instead! 

If you feel led to share this video, as well- feel free!

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Her name is Sylvie Therrien. She has been working for HRSDC since January 2011, and from October 2012 as an Employment Insurance (EI) "integrity services investigator". This campaign to provide her with living expenses was an idea some of us Canadians came up with because, in May 2013, Sylvie was suspended without pay on suspicion of leaking information to the media about an unethical EI quota system.

What Happened

In Canada we are supposed to have a whistleblower's protection act, but in reality we don't have protection for people who expose government wrong-doing. Sylvie Therrien could not continue, in good consience, working quietly within government "quota" guidelines for EI. When she questioned her superiors about the ethics of the practise, her concerns were laughed off because the EI managers could get bonuses for big cuts to EI payouts. She realized that cutting people off rightfully earned EI only served one purpose: to make the government look good by saying that fewer people were unemployed. Spin Spin Spin was what these quotas were about.

So Sylvie, at great peril to her own future earnings, stepped up and told the media about this unethical action by the Government of Canada. In our interview (http://livestream.com/occupyearth) she explains how she was told to disallow EI benefits for frivolous reasons in order to meet a quota of $485,000 in disallowed benefits per year

The Impact

Think about that: almost 1/2 million a year of denied benefits per investigator in the office where she worked. How many others were doing the same in that office? How many others are doing the same in offices across the country? At a time when Canadians are unemployed and vulnerable, our government is working behind the scenes to cut their legs out from under them! How many people are struggling more then ever before so that the government can misdirect EI benefits to other uses, like $50 million gazebos, helicopter fishing trips for ministers and ridiculous Economic Action Plan ads? 

You Can Help

Sylvie Therrien, an employee of Services Canada, was suspended without pay on suspicion of being a whistleblower. Her hearing is now postponed until September.  Sylvie's union (SEIU) has told her that this could be a long battle, and in the meantime the government knows that Sylvie is a single mother with bills to pay. This is just another government BULLY tactic to shut whistleblowers up. If the government top-cats can't do it by prosecuting them, they will do it by starving the leaker.

Let's stand up for Sylvie, who stood up for us! Even in these tough times, we believe that caring Canadians would be willing to donate to help pay the living expenses of someone who stood up for fellow Canadians.  Whether you can only afford $1 or can handle a larger donation of $5, $10 or even $100, know that your support is greatly appreciated. And please help by sharing this message with other caring Canadians. Together we can show Sylvie that yes, Canadians do care and Canadians support whistleblowers!

 

En français

Dénonciatrice : Quotas à l’assurance- emploi

 Une campagne est engagée par un groupe de citoyens Canadiens afin
d’aider Sylvie Therrien financièrement car depuis le 13 mai 2013, elle est
suspendue sans solde.

Voici les faits: 

Sylvie a débuté son emploi comme agente de programme aux
Ressources Humaines et Développement Canada en Janvier 2011. À partir d’Octobre
2012, sujette aux coupures du gouvernement fédéral, elle n’a d'autre choix que
d'accepter un transfert au service de l'Intégrité à titre d'enquêteur à
l’Assurance- emploi.

Voir l' entrevue avec Sylvie

(http://livestream.com/occupyearth) En français

Sylvie se sent incapable de continuer à travailler en paix avec
elle-même en utilisant  un système de quotas et des pratiques
d’intimidations auprès des prestataires de revenu. Lorsqu’elle questionne ses
supérieurs sur les pratiques de quotas, ceux-ci essaient de la convaincre de ne
pas s’en faire en prétextant qu’il y a beaucoup de fraudes et de gens qui
abusent du système et que les économies (quotas) se feront facilement, si elle
fait son travail. Elle insiste donc sur le fait qu’elle trouve ces pratiques
injustes et préjudiciables aux chômeurs. Ses supérieurs l’étiquètent aussitôt
de «fauteur de trouble ». Les problèmes de Sylvie au travail augmentent, elle
subit de l’intimidation et lorsqu’elle se plaint à la directrice, on lui répond
qu’une enquête interne conclut que ses allégations de milieu de travail
non-sain et de racismes à l'égard des nouveaux Canadiens et de préjugés contre
les autochtones ne sont pas fondés. De plus, que Sylvie pourrait être passible
de réprimandes, si elle fait de tels commentaires dans le futur.

Ajoutons que les pratiques de quotas imposées aux enquêteurs
permettent aux gestionnaires de recevoir des bonis de plus de $50,000 à la fin
de l’année fiscale si leur équipe d’enquêteurs performe et rencontre les
objectifs.

Malgré la menace de perdre son emploi, Sylvie expose ces pratiques
aux médias et aux Canadiens en les informant sur ce qu'il se passe à leur insu
et avec leurs cotisations d’assurance-emploi. Elle explique pourquoi on coupe
ou refuse les prestations d'assurance-emploi aux chômeurs. Ceux qu’on
pénalisent permettent au gouvernement de faire des économies de
$35,000-$40,000/mois, ce qui équivaut a $485,000/année. L’impact : ½ million
par année de paiement d’assurance-emploi multiplie par chaque enquêteur dans
chaque bureau de Service Canada à travers le pays équivaut a des millions
d’économies ou d’argent volé aux Canadiens!

 Le gouvernement remonte la filière jusqu'à Sylvie. L’employeur,
sans preuve, décide qu’elle est coupable et la suspend sans solde sur le champ,
pour fin d'enquête des le 13 mai 2013.


Voir: Entrevue entre Opi avec Sylvie sur les Qutas et autres practques a l'assurance-emploi(Merci de votre indulgence c'est une entrevue-maison)

 http://youtu.be/vlpx5WXTbOI

L’Impacte des quotas

En cette période de difficultés économiques, beaucoup de Canadiens
et Canadiennes se retrouvent en position vulnérable et sans emploi. L’état doit
les supporter ou du moins, ne pas détourner les fonds payés par ces canadiens
vers des bonis versés aux gestionnaires. On paie des voyages en hélicoptère à
des ministres qui vont à la pèche, des campagnes publicitaires astronomiques ,
des dépenses obsènes de sénateurs,la promotion coueuse de plans d’action
économique qui ne fonctionnent pas. Sylvie, comme la majorité des
Canadiens, croit que ce fond d’assurance-emploi appartient aux chômeurs
Canadiens et non pas au gouvernement Canadien pour en disposer à sa guise. Il
s'agit d'un filet social et il ne devrait servir qu'en ce sens. Il est clair
qu'un système de quotas est inadmissible!

Sylvie Therrien, employée à Service Canada a été suspendue sans
solde le 13 mai 2013 sous des allégations sans preuve. L’employeur, notre
gouvernement, a décidé d’avance que Sylvie était coupable avant même de
commencer leur enquête puisqu’elle a été puni par une coupure immédiate de
salaire. L' enquête qui a suivi peut être  qualifiée de bidon puisque
l'audience sur sa suspension sans solde a été remise à plus tard, soit à la
mi-septembre, sous prétexte qu'on n'a pas pu trouver de date accommodante
pour  l’employeur et  assurant  une représentation syndicale
bilingue pour défendre Sylvie. Comment Sylvie doit-elle payer ses factures en
attendant?

Le Canada possède une loi qui protège les «Whistleblowers-dénonciateurs » qui exposent publiquement des pratiques non-éthiques au sein du gouvernement et pourtant...


Vous pouvez aider :

Même en ces temps difficiles, nous croyons que les Canadiens et
les Canadiennes peuvent faire preuve de solidarité, d’entraide et de compassion
afin d’aider Sylvie, qui a perdu son emploi. Aidons-là, aucune contribution
n’est trop petite et merci à l'avance pour votre générosité. 


 Les canadiens ont besoin d'employée honnète comme Sylvie pour exposer la vérité et Sylvie a maintenant besoin de nous!

On paie des voyages en hélicoptère àdes ministres qui vont à la pèche, des campagnes publicitaires astronomiques ,des dépenses obsènes de sénateurs,la promotion coueuse de plans d’actionéconomique qui ne fonctionnent pas. Sylvie, comme la majorité desCanadiens, croit que ce fond d’assurance-emploi appartient aux chômeursCanadiens et non pas au gouvernement Canadien pour en disposer à sa guise. Ils'agit d'un filet social et il ne devrait servir qu'en ce sens. Il est clairqu'un système de quotas est inadmissible!
Sylvie Therrien, employée à Service Canada a été suspendue sanssolde le 13 mai 2013 sous des allégations sans preuve. L’employeur, notregouvernement, a décidé d’avance que Sylvie était coupable avant même decommencer leur enquête puisqu’elle a été puni par une coupure immédiate desalaire. L' enquête qui a suivi peut être  qualifiée de bidon puisquel'audience sur sa suspension sans solde a été remise à plus tard, soit à lami-septembre, sous prétexte qu'on n'a pas pu trouver de date accommodantepour  l’employeur et  assurant  une représentation syndicalebilingue pour défendre Sylvie. Comment Sylvie doit-elle payer ses factures enattendant?
Le Canada possède une loi qui protège les «Whistleblowers-dénonciateurs » qui exposent publiquement des pratiques non-éthiques au sein du gouvernement et pourtant...

Vous pouvez aider :

Même en ces temps difficiles, nous croyons que les Canadiens etles Canadiennes peuvent faire preuve de solidarité, d’entraide et de compassionafin d’aider Sylvie, qui a perdu son emploi. Aidons-là, aucune contributionn’est trop petite et merci à l'avance pour votre générosité. 
 Les canadiens ont besoin d'employée honnète comme Sylvie pour exposer la vérité et Sylvie a maintenant besoin de nous!

story:
Education is an ever-growing need in our world’s struggling economy. Receiving an education is a basic human right, just like having clean drinking water or having food to eat. In the developing world, and even in America, there is not enough access to an affordable and effective education. Without an education, children lack the sources to develop skills such as creativity, problem solving, and leadership to solve the world’s biggest problems. The education systems around the world are in a state of crisis. In the developing world, children beg for an education.

In fact, there are more than 61 million preschool-aged children that do not even have access to education in the world. That number does not even include the 266 million adolescents out of school every day around the world. If every country had 40 percent of their men and women able to read and write, they would develop more quickly than their current rates.

I work with an NGO called Pencils of Promise that builds schools in the developing world for communities that truly want them. We then stay on the ground and hire teachers and staff from in the community while keeping a few Pencils of Promise staff around to make sure the school stays in tact. The founder, Adam Braun (Semester at Sea Spring 2005 Alum), came up with the idea while on Semester at Sea and inspired me to apply. He made a habit out of asking every child he met what they wanted most in the world and a child beggar on the streets in India simply said, “a pencil.”  Pencils of Promise works in communities to build schools and empower young leaders to in turn empower the world around them.

The story that has had the biggest effect on me is about Adam’s early work with Pencils of Promise when one day he was backpacking in Laos, a small country in Southeast Asia. Adam said he came across a group of children huddled over a broken chalkboard, practicing their letters on the weekend. The fact that we complain in America as children because we have to go to school completely hides the effective power behind a confident, imaginative, empowered, and educated individual. We take advantage of what so many people around the world beg to receive.

Through Semester at Sea, I will be able to learn more about the developing world and immerse myself in international cultures that I have never had the opportunity to come in contact with before. Through the global comparative education offered through Semester at Sea I will become well equipped to learn more about a world I know little about. The knowledge and experience I gain from this trip will introduce me to a new way of thinking and will prepare me for my future work in nonprofits. It will help me realize even more that I am not just a citizen of the United States, but also a global citizen. Hopefully the knowledge, global experience, and life skills I learn on the Semester at Sea program will help me to reach my dream job, a staff member at Pencils of Promise, and become a strong force doing everything I can to bring educational opportunity to those in need all around the world, especially women, While on the trip, I will be researching the disparity of educational opportunity to women around the world. This will potentially help me to create a program to implement in schools that will encourage women to receive an education and become empowered. Please help this dream become a reality as my parents and I are not able to afford the $30,000 trip on our own. Through your donation, scholarships, work-study, and personal letters to friends and family, this dream can become a reality.  Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Young Israelis & Palestinians are working together for change. Show them you believe.

Why does this matter?

The lives of Palestinians and Israelis are inherently intertwined - we share common resources like water and land. No matter what the final political status will look like, there needs to be a network of Israeli and Palestinian leaders who can work together to solve common problems. 

However, the current isolation and dehumanization between the sides has led Palestinians and Israelis to lose hope and become apathetic to each other's needs and fears. This must be changed.

Our core belief is that building a more just and peaceful future between Palestinians and Israelis is a necessity for both sides. This is the time to act, before the window of opportunity closes, and this is what MEET works to achieve. 



What is MEET doing?

For the past 10 years, we have been bringing together, educating and empowering the most promising Israeli and Palestinian leaders as part of a growing bi-national network that can take action towards creating positive economic, social and political change in the region. When you mix youth, technology and entrepreneurship amazing things can happen. 

We partnered with MIT, Google, HP, Hebrew University and others to build a three year technology, entrepreneurship and leadership program for excelling Palestinian and Israeli young leaders, taught by volunteers from MIT. Once students graduate from MEET they join MEET's Alumni Network. MEET helps them stay in touch, develop academically and professionally and through our Venture Lab, in partnership with Google, supports their initiatives aimed at impacting their communities. 

Learn more here: All ThingsD, WIRED, Fast Company & MIT President Reif.

What will this campaign do?

Help us raise money and awareness so MEET can impact more young Palestinian and Israeli leaders. Send them a clear message to not lose hope and to act towards positive change in the Middle East.

This is a chance to invest in something that really matters! This campaign aims to raise at minimum $10,000. MEET is a 501(c)(3) and all donations are tax deductible. 

The money raised will support scholarships for Israeli and Palestinian students to join the MEET program - just like Amin and Yuval, two students who graduated this past summer (see right below).

What have we done so far?

Over the past 10 years, MEET has:

  • Created a network of 450 Palestinian and Israeli young leaders who would otherwise not have had the chance to meet each other, let alone work together towards common goals

  • Scaled to work in 11 cities in the West Bank and within Israel

  • Launched a Venture Lab with Google for MEET alumni to develop their own social and business ventures to impact the region

  • Impacted hundreds of Palestinians and Israelis and 100+ MIT students, alumni and faculty who spent time in the Middle East learning about the conflict and how they can contribute

Recently President Obama mentioned MEET as an example of how innovation is reshaping the Middle East. See part of his speech here:

story:
WHO IS TONILYN?

Through out the years, I have supported and helped people access their own creativity and I came to understand that I too need to take space for my own focused learning in an academic setting with people who are motivated, creative and tenacious in their discipline and craft.  I have been accepted into the MFA program at Stony Brook University, Southampton (YAY!) to train in the highly collaborative and professional Thearter Arts and Film track.  I am super excited that this program is embracing a genderqueer POC like me...and now I need your help getting there!!!

My academic pursuits in Theater Arts & Film will be the catalyst into the next phase of my artistry where I will be able to bridge my theater and filmmaking pursuits.  My scholastic, technical and entrepreneurial goal to create and participate in theater and filmmaking that is socially relevant, empowering and accessible motivates me to be the very best for my community.  It is not only a desire of mine to earn an MFA in Theater Arts, it is vital to my trajectory as I inspire systemic social change, using theater and film as a platform for activism, healing, community building and ultimately survival.

I am a proud genderqueer filipin@ born and raised in San Francisco.  I have spent the last 10 years employed by SF Bay Area non-profits, in which I worked closely with queer and transgender youth of color and adult queer women and transgender people of color as an arts as activism/media project program coordinator, facilitator and workshop instructor teaching queer history, media and film with an anti-oppression and healing framework.  In the evenings, I worked on my craft as a singer, performer and filmmaker; having been involved in various Bay Area theater productions and events.

WHAT ARE THE FUNDS FOR?

My partner, Sarah, also got into grad school at DePaul in Chicago! On August 8th, we will drive and begin our big adventure from Oakland to Chicago to move her in and then continue on to upstate New York.  The trip is a total of about 3,000 miles.  We are stopping in 8 cities along the way to keep us fed, well-rested and sane on the road.

The funds that I am raising with this campaign will go directly to getting us to our new cities (gas, toll, lodging & meals). I hope to raise at least $2,500 to cover expenses to get there.  Any funds raised above the amount needed for travel will go towards my books, school fees and tuition.  Also, scholarships and grants are not given to first-year students in the program and I must raise these funds in order to even attend!

THE IMPACT

I want to see more people like me represented and visible on stage and in film. I am convinced that there is a place for me as an actor and filmmaker.  I can initiate conversations, bridge current understandings of gender, and still be a part of the landscape of traditional, innovative and experimental theater and film.  I am determined to create work that is relevant to my experience and reflective of experiences of queer and transgender people of color. I know now that it will not be created for us...but that I too have to write the stories I want seen on stage and on the big screen.  After my studies, I plan to continue to facilitate and support the work of queer and transgender people of color as a professor/mentor, actor and director working directly with my communities.
 

It has been a trying year, emotionally and financially.  And I know that success doesn't come just from the hard work of one individual.  In my creative work over the years, I've learned how to ask for help and that it takes a team to lift each other up. With your support, I will be able to continue onto the next phase of my journey as I work hard to change the gender binary and racial politics in theater and film.

Other Ways You Can Help

Know of anyone who would like to support my cause? Please get the word out and signal boost my campaign!  


You are also invited to my birthday/going away party!  Let's booty shake and celebrate new beginnings!  SAVE THE DATE: August 4th in Oakland, CA!!!

story:
We are excited to announce that Aesthetics and Therapeutics Lab has been selected for the June, 2014 Full Dome Artist-in-Residency program hosted by Vortex Immersion Media in Los Angeles, California.

Aesthetics and Therapeutics Lab is a collective consisting of art therapist Dr. Marina Masic and emerging media artist Jakob LeBaron Dwight formed in 2013 to initiate experiments and installations in art and healing.

The Vortex Dome studio is a state of the art facility specializing in production and design for effects, gaming, interactive, experiential themed entertainment and immersive dome installation.

ATL will receive exclusive access to the Vortex Dome LA in a state of the art facility located at the heart of L.A. Center Studios, as well as dome production training, consultation with leading experts in the field, and a cumulative dome art show in late June.

In this residency program ATL will be exploring Multi Sensory Environments MSE and their multiple benefits on various populations.

According to findings by MSE pioneer Linda Messbauer, these unique therapeutic environments have shown significant and positive effects for users diagnosed with autism, brain injury, challenging behaviors, dementia, developmental disabilities, mental illness, PTSD, learning disabilities and more.  

The results of this research will be developed into art therapy modules to be shared with practitioners internationally.

Aesthetics & Therapuetics Lab needs your help to meet supporting costs for the upcoming residency to be able to participate and additionally to pay for transportation to Los Angeles and personal living expenses while there.  We are attempting to raise $5,000 for this endeavor.

Each donor will be gifted with an original artwork by Jakob LeBaron Dwight.

Thank you for your support of this exciting project and continued research into the fusion of art and science.

www.vorteximmersion.com

story:
About Us

Hope of Guinea is a 501c3 nonprofit organization that invests in the education of talented young children from underprivileged backgrounds in Guinea, West Africa. Hope of Guinea provides scholarships to cover tuition, uniforms, school supplies, tutoring and other education related expenses. This support is guaranteed until the student graduates high school.

Hope of Guinea is run by a team of volunteers who are committed to breaking the barriers that prevent disadvantaged children from attending school. Education is one of the most empowering ways of breaking disparities across gender and poverty. We are dedicated to ensuring that under privileged children are not forgotten, but given the same opportunity to be a productive part of our society. When you educate a child you positively impact his/her life as well as that of his/her community. When you invest in Hope of Guinea, you invest in the prosperity of young minds.

To learn more, please visit our website: www.hopeofguinea.org

Public Library Project

Many children in Guinea cannot read at grade level. According to the World Bank only 63.4% of Guinean youth between the ages 15 to 24 can read and only 57% of females of that age bracket can read and write. These numbers are even lower for children under the age of 15. In order to remedy this major issue, improving the early grade-reading competency is a must. It is with these statistics in mind that Hope of Guinea has started its project to open the first fully functioning public library in Guinea.

Hope of Guinea has partnered with the County of Dixinn in Conakry, Guinea to open the first fully functioning public library in Guinea. We have started this campaign to raise money to pay for the setup of the library, including shelving, tables, computer desks, and other miscellaneous items such as lamps, electrical and internet outlets, security equipment to secure computers and tablets, and a computer equipped with a librarian system to monitor usage.

Through a partnership with Books For Africa, we were able to send a container of 30,563 new French books to Guinea in November 2013, which will be used to supply the library. We have also received a donation of 25 DataWind Educational Tablets through Dr. Sarah McCue, a Professor at Georgetown University.  The tablets will serve as critical components for the computer lab to be opened within the library. We are seeking donations for 20 additional computers, two heavy-duty printers and scanners along with other necessary educational software. These computers will help expose children to new technologies thus helping them adapt to an evolving world.

The County of Dixinn has provided the infrastructure for the library, a computer lab and land to build a basketball court. The library will be housed in the same compound as the Jozip Broz Tito Elementary and Middle School located in the city of Belle-Vue in Conakry, Guinea.  The library will be free of charge and available to all children.



Hope of Guinea is a 501c(3) tax-exempt charitable organization under IRS section 170(b)(2)(iii), so we will be able to provide you with a federal tax identification number. Gifts to Hope of Guinea are tax-deductible to the fullest extent of the law.

Highlighted Perk Levels

*** Please note that after every T-shirt purchase, we will email you directly to collect your style, color, and size ***






                                               Picture 1 (Kora & Balafon)


                              Picture 2 (Guinean Hand Made Wall Pictures)


     Picture 3 (1 traditional Mask, A traditional food bowl, A traditional Placemat)


Picture 4 (Eating bowl made with seashells, Traditional made music instruments)


Picture 5 (Forest Guinea Region Authentic Ceremonial Cloth, a set of traditional food bowls and set of traditional placemats)


Picture 6 (Middle Guinea Region Authentic Ceremonial Cloth, a set of traditional food bowls and set of traditional placemats)


                             Picture 7 (A traditional mask and a traditional Drum)


                                Picture 8 (2 traditional Guinean sculptures)


Ways You Can Help


Hope of Guinea is a 501c(3) tax-exempt charitable organization under IRS section 170(b)(2)(iii), so we will be able to provide you with a federal tax identification number. Gifts to Hope of Guinea are tax-deductible to the fullest extent of the law.

instruments)Picture 5 (Forest Guinea Region Authentic Ceremonial Cloth, a set of traditional food bowls
and set of traditional placemats)Picture 6 (Middle Guinea Region Authentic Ceremonial Cloth, a set of traditional food bowls
and set of traditional placemats)                             Picture 7 (A traditional mask and a traditional Drum)                                Picture 8 (2 traditional Guinean sculptures)
Ways You Can HelpHope of Guinea is a 501c(3) tax-exempt charitable organization under IRS section 170(b)(2)(iii), so we will be able to provide you with a federal tax identification number. Gifts to Hope of Guinea are tax-deductible to the fullest extent of the law.

story:
Introduction and Background

I am an engineer by profession and my hobby is to create audio books in my mother tongue which is Bengali, an Indian language. I publish my audiobooks through internet. One day in 2012 a person sent me an email from West Bengal, India that he is blind and he works for a blind school where they regularly listen my audio books. He also wrote that they do not have many books in Braille and that’s why they cannot read all books. But as I narrate the stories, they can simply listen to it. It really touched me. I was creating audio books as my hobby for those people who do not have time to read. I never thought of making audio books for blind people, it never came to my mind. After knowing this I started asking more questions about the school and I learned that it is in a rural village of West Bengal, India. Majority of the students are very poor, school provides them boarding, lodging and study materials in Braille. The facility provides special arrangement for its students keeping in mind the requirements of the blind kids. The school gets a nominal funding from Government sources which is not at all sufficient for running the school with teachers, staff and boarding facilities. So they need people like you and me who can donate and help these unfortunate kids to continue their education. For them, education or light of knowledge is the only thing that can change their life. Without education, these kids would have no means to lead a good life and might end up begging in the streets. Last year we raised $1535 using this Indiegogo platform and supported 10 sightless students to complete their education for one year. This year also I need your help to support 10 sightness students. 8 of them retained from last year and 2 students were added in place of 2 who graduated from middle school.

Description of the campaign and why it’s important to me

It is really very tough for a blind kid to continue his/her education. In India it is even tougher due to lack of infrastructure, poverty and lack of social awareness. For these 10 blind kids in Krishanagar India, education is the only means available to them for social recognition. Krishnanagar Helen Keller Vidhyapith is the place where blind kids can study up to middle school. The school provides education, study materials in braille and living assistance in dorm. Each student requires $150 for his/her expense in the school for one year. I on behalf of Mukti for social Development, a California based non profit public benefit corporation (IRS Employer Identification Number - 26-2650992) am seeking $1500 for supporting these 10 poor blind kids for next year in school starting January 2014. Failure to provide this amount to the kids could result in discontinuation of school for some of them. Please donate and help the blind kids to get the light of knowledge. This project is very close to my heart because my Grandfather became blind at an age of 58. I have seen how difficult his life became after he lost his sight. Life became horrible for him and infrastructure was not there to support him. My grandfather was not poor, his biggest problem was he could not see. But these 10 blind kids I choose are very poor. So with a little monetary help, at least they will be able to get some education and live a respectful life.


How much funding I need and where it’s going

Each student requires a scholarship of $150 per year which will cover their school fee, study materials in Braille, audio books and hostel fee. So I will require $1500 for supporting 10 blind students for a year. Your entire donations will go to the Krishnanagar Helen Keller Vidyapith and Shaktinagar High School in West Bengal, India. 

My track record with projects like this

  • Last year I collected $1535 for 10 blind students of the same schools. Visit the project at https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/a-campaign-to-support-10-blind-kids-to-continue-education/x/723409
  • I always try to help underprivileged kids. In year 2010 I read in newspaper about a 3 months old kid named Kaushik Debnath from Tripura, India who needed a difficult heart surgery but his parents being very poor were not able to afford. I contacted my friends and through emails and Facebook and I collected some money which was not sufficient. Then I contacted a non-profit organization named Pashchimi and their donor base donated a lot. I collected a little over $2000 which helped Kaushik's parents pay for the heart surgery. Thanks to the surgery, now Kaushik is leading a normal life.
  • My other project was with the non-profit organization named Mukti for Social Development. In this project, I helped to organize a 10K run to collect money for solar lights in Sundarban region of West Bengal, India. We managed to provide solar lamps to 120 families living without electricity. The details of the project are available athttp://muktiforsocialdevelopment.org/shownews.php?newsid=100000166
  • Another project that I do during festive season is Holiday Toy Drive. In the year 2011, I collected over 50 new toys donated by employees of Semtech Inc, a semiconductor company based in California. The details of this project are at http://muktiforsocialdevelopment.org/shownews.php?newsid=100000165

story:
Inspire Kids to Dream Big, Set Goals, and Persevere

We believe kids have what it takes, and that sometimes all they need to reach their dreams is a champion. Classroom Champions partners with teachers in grades K-8 classrooms to provide inspirational mentor relationships between Olympians and Paralympians, and classrooms at under-served schools. Our amazing teachers facilitate this relationship, engage their students in lessons about subjects like goal-setting, perseverance, community, leadership, and friendship, and support students in giving back to their communities. 

Inspired kids + Inspired teachers + Inspired mentors = Inspired communities.

Want to donate to support Canadian students? Click here.

Your donation will be doubled...

Classroom Champions was founded in 2009 by Olympic Gold Medalist (now our President & CEO) Steve Mesler, and his sister Dr. Leigh Mesler Parise because they believe kids deserve a bright future. Classroom Champions now inspires kids in the US, Canada, and throughout the Caribbean with incredible mentors and committed teachers. We need your help to inspire more kids, and to continue our work of providing social and emotional skills through mentorship to deserving kids. 

Why is Social and Emotional Learning important for kids to grow up successful? Read Steve Mesler's brief Op-Ed here!


What We Need & What You Get

  • GOAL: $12,000. This money will ensure support to TWO MORE classrooms of kids in the U.S. That's two classrooms in some of our most at-need areas of the country that will receive mentorship from our best athletes for the entire school year. Your donations will support, train and connect passionate teachers and engage families and communities to help kids learn the skills they need to succeed in school and in life!

  • PERKS for YOU: To see the awesome benefits you receive for supporting Classroom Champions kids, look over there ------------------>
 
  • WHAT HAPPENS IF CLASSROOM CHAMPIONS DOESN'T MEET OUR GOAL or IF YOUH HELP US EXCEED IT? That's an easy one... if we don't reach our goal, your support will help as many kids and teachers as possible. If you help us exceed our goal - MORE KIDS will participate and learn the skills they need to succeed!

We inspire kids to dream big, set goals, and persevere. We believe every child has the right to learn the process of excellence, yet many students in under-served communities face significant barriers to gaining these critical skills. We work hard to partner with teachers to instill qualities of excellence in students that will last the rest of their lives.

Why is Classroom Champions important to kids and schools?

Classroom Champions is an innovator in social and emotional education across the continent. Our unique method sees thousands of students lives changed on a yearly basis at a fraction of the cost of traditional programs that see similar results. Social and emotional learning is so important that the renowned Brookings Institute recently said social and emotional development is the next school reform frontier and quoted that:
"...for every dollar invested in Social and Emotional Learning programs, there is a return of eleven dollars, a rate of economic return that would be the envy even of hedge funds."
- Brookings Institute

A University of Chicago* study of more than 20,000 students proved that graduating from high school had more to do with student attendance and grades in middle school than their test scores in middle school!

- Well, 100% of Classroom Champions teachers say being a part of the program INCREASED ENGAGEMENT in their classrooms. If you were engaged, would you be more likely to attend work or school?

For the past five years Classroom Champions has been partnering with teachers in the schools that need our help the most to change the lives of the kids they teach. Want to see all the other ways Classroom Champions transforms kids, teachers and mentors? Click here for our impact results!
Our innovative system to inspire students, support teachers, and transform schools:


Get involved! Other Ways You Can Help:

Right now, what we need most are the financial resources to help us make things happen. What can you do? Spread the word, tell the story of why you are involved, and invite others to join you in giving. Share our cause with your workplace. Find out if your employer has a donation matching program. Here are some ideas:

  • Share Classroom Champions’ campaign with your family, friends, and social networks.
  • When you share with family and friends, send a personal email, message, or even a phone call. 
  • When you share on social media, tag @ClassroomChamps. Here is this fundraiser link to share with your friends and family: http://www.classroomchampions.org/content/755/2015-Indiegogo-Campaign
  • We would love to hear your story about someone who inspired you to be the person you are today. Tweet, comment, and/or post on Facebook and we'll share your story too!


The Perks!

*Selecting a perk will allow 90% of your donation to be tax deductible. We can't give you a tax receipt for the sweet gear you're going to get - sorry!

story:
Howdy and Hello,

My name is Lauren Savoy, and I am so very happy you've found my page and are interested in supporting my dreams. After graduating Cum Laude with a degree in Advertising, I spent 2.5 years in rural West Africa (a very small village called Sourou in Burkina Faso, specifically) as a Community Health Development Worker for the Peace Corps (2010-2012) where I discovered my passion and future career goal: midwifery. Granted, I wasn't birthing babies at that time, but I was lucky enough to witness and participate in a handful of live births and was actively working with pregnant women and new mothers in addition to many other projects concerning Malaria, HIV/AIDS, Family Planning, Hygiene and Nutrition. 

I am excited to begin my very intense and competitive journey of prerequisites, testing, and applications on January 21st 2014. I will be taking a strenuous cocktail of biology, chemistry and humanities courses for the next two years. In order to stand out from the crowd, I am also pursuing volunteer positions, internships (paid or unpaid) or part-time work at birthing centers while simultaneously making straight A's: no ifs, ands, or buts on this one. My schooling will become my career.

With your support, I will be able to afford the numerous textbooks, supplies and expenses that come with these courses (dang! I don't remember things being this expensive). 

What I Need & What You Get

Breaking it down for y'all in more detail:

I am in need of approximately $8,000 for a grand total of 16 science courses, their accompanying textbooks and the copious supplies necessary. This semester alone has cost:

  • Four lectures + two labs = $900
  • 10 textbooks (through amazon and other sites to get the best price) = $889
  • Supplies (notebooks, index cards, binders, etc.) = $150 - $200

The perks, because I am not a musician or artist campaigning for an album or art show, will be personalized thank you emails and other little treats like cookies, shout out's on my blog or Facebook, or hand-drawn pictures among other goodies.

  • Personalized, decorated, hand-written letter
  • Your favorite made-from-scratch cookies
  • Shout-out on my blog/tumblr and Facebook
  • One nicely printed photograph
  • Crafty drawing / art-piece from yours truly
  • An invitation to my "I Got Accepted to Grad School" party

If I don't reach my goal, I will be able to keep the funds that were raised and use those responsibly for their intended use. I will then continue my course until I reach my goal by finding a part-time job that allows financial stability and the freedom to study rigorously to make the desired 4.0.

Why YOUR Contribution is Valued!

I believe in safe births and the right of women to have a voice in their birth plan. I aim to be an advocate for women and their partner's ability to choose how they plan their family and what their ideal birth outcome will be. I absolutely loved working with pregnant women and new mothers and helping them achieve their goals of having a healthy gestation and baby; I want to continue this work both domestically and internationally.

With your support, I will:

  • Complete from my 16 course prerequisite journey.
  • Be accepted to my top 10 Masters programs across the USA.
  • Excel at the University and graduate as a Certified Nurse Midwife, NP.
  • Work domestically while gaining additional international training.
  • Have a career that allows three to six months of international volunteering each year.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute and that's okay, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask your friends, family, co-workers, partners in crime, classmates, EVERYONE to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign!
  • Share this on your Facebook, Tumblr or blog.
  • If you can't help support me, try sending an email with this link to people you believe will care about my journey.
  • I will be updating my Tumblr regularly, go ahead and follow me and share it with your folks.

That's all! I sincerely appreciate everything you have given and wish you health and happiness! Thank you very much for stopping by, I hope you will help spread the word.

story:
Short Summary

For one week in March 2014 the first Summer School for ICT4Democracy will take place in New Delhi. ICTs (Information and Communication Technologies) are central for the development of democracies and civic participation. About 30 Master and PhD students have been selected on the basis of the quality of their research.They are coming from 15 different countries, among them are many developing countries, such as Nigeria, Pakistan, Turkmenistan or Egypt.

What We Need & What You Get

We want to provide free accommodation, food and ground transportation for our summer school students. To be able to do this, we need your help to raise 6500 US-Dollars.

We have approached a number of institutions and have received funding for the keynote lecturers. However, there seems to be no money available to support the participating students. Help us help our young researchers.

Every contribution counts and the perks below illustrate how we intend to thank you for your generosity.

The Impact

The use of online platforms in encouraging participation and democratization is becoming commonplace - not just in theory. Employing a platform such as this for raising funds for the participation of our young researchers further underscores the impact ICTs can have in today`s society.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread our cause in your networks and feel free to contact us for further sponsoring opportunities or ideas.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Introduction

Westview CyberSecurity is a high school organization focused on fostering cybersecurity education among teenagers. Founded in 2009, the club has since won 2nd at the national US CyberPatriot competition as well as 1st at the San Diego Mayor's Cup CyberChallenge. With over sixty members for the 2013-2014 school year, we're looking to compete in the US CyberPatriot competition this year.

Cybersecurity is a rapidly growing industry today. From your local power company's critical infrastructure to the antivirus installed your computer to the CIA's signal intelligence efforts, cybersecurity plays a huge role in all of our daily lives. Just imagine if your bank's website gave away your credit card information to anyone who asked for it! (http://goo.gl/pQP2tX)

At Westview CyberSecurity, we don't compete for money or fame. We compete because we know, that in a planet increasingly populated with black hat hackers, there needs to be a light side making sure the world's information is safe.

The main competition we participate in is called US CyberPatriot, and registration is expensive, especially for high schoolers. Your contribution will help train a new generation of cybersecurity professionals - on the good side.

If you have any questions, don't hesitate to contact me at raj.ksvn@gmail.com.

What We Need

US CyberPatriot costs $400 to register per team of nine students. We estimate that we need at least $1,500 to operate for the 2013-2014 school year.

The funds will go toward registering students new to the world of cybersecurity and helping them understand the importance of the field and delve into the depths of the material.

If we are not able to meet our goal, we will still be able to use the money to register as many students as we can. The remainder will go toward registering for the other competitions we participate in, such as CyberAces, the San Diego Mayor's Cup CyberChallenge, and PicoCTF.

The Impact

Every single member of Westview CyberSecurity takes the field very seriously. While we have our fun, we are aware of the massive importance of cybersecurity both in the workplace and the world. By fostering education early on, we are able to encourage students new to the field and engage everyone in actively learning. We want to make a difference in the world, and we believe that one way to do that is to strengthen security.

Historically, we have excelled in these competitions. Three years ago the team traveled to Washington, D.C. and received 2nd place at the national US CyberPatriot competition Last year, we won $2,500 at the San Diego Mayor's Cup CyberChallenge as well as a week-long training session in ethical hacking (http://goo.gl/hzX0yE).

We take the time to train all our members before each competition and prepare in every way possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

You don't have to contribute to help us! Post this project on Facebook, Twitter, Reddit - anything you can think of to get the word out. 

If you or your organization possesses cybersecurity knowledge or resources, we would love to come and learn from you. Westview CyberSecurity is always trying to improve, and if you can help us in this regard, we would greatly appreciate it.

You can use the share tools on the project page to share quickly.


Westview CyberSecurity is currently sponsored by BAE Systems, ISPA Technology, Dennis Aleynikov, and David Anderson. We are immensely grateful for their support.
story_txt:
Introduction





Westview CyberSecurity is a high school organization focused on fostering cybersecurity education among teenagers. Founded in 2009, the club has since won 2nd at the national US CyberPatriot competition as well as 1st at the San Diego Mayor's Cup CyberChallenge. With over sixty members for the 2013-2014 school year, we're looking to compete in the US CyberPatriot competition this year.
Cybersecurity is a rapidly growing industry today. From your local power company's critical infrastructure to the antivirus installed your computer to the CIA's signal intelligence efforts, cybersecurity plays a huge role in all of our daily lives. Just imagine if your bank's website gave away your credit card information to anyone who asked for it! (http://goo.gl/pQP2tX)
At Westview CyberSecurity, we don't compete for money or fame. We compete because we know, that in a planet increasingly populated with black hat hackers, there needs to be a light side making sure the world's information is safe.
The main competition we participate in is called US CyberPatriot, and registration is expensive, especially for high schoolers. Your contribution will help train a new generation of cybersecurity professionals - on the good side.
If you have any questions, don't hesitate to contact me at raj.ksvn@gmail.com.


What We Need



US CyberPatriot costs $400 to register per team of nine students. We estimate that we need at least $1,500 to operate for the 2013-2014 school year.
The funds will go toward registering students new to the world of cybersecurity and helping them understand the importance of the field and delve into the depths of the material.
If we are not able to meet our goal, we will still be able to use the money to register as many students as we can. The remainder will go toward registering for the other competitions we participate in, such as CyberAces, the San Diego Mayor's Cup CyberChallenge, and PicoCTF.


The Impact





Every single member of Westview CyberSecurity takes the field very seriously. While we have our fun, we are aware of the massive importance of cybersecurity both in the workplace and the world. By fostering education early on, we are able to encourage students new to the field and engage everyone in actively learning. We want to make a difference in the world, and we believe that one way to do that is to strengthen security.
Historically, we have excelled in these competitions. Three years ago the team traveled to Washington, D.C. and received 2nd place at the national US CyberPatriot competition Last year, we won $2,500 at the San Diego Mayor's Cup CyberChallenge as well as a week-long training session in ethical hacking (http://goo.gl/hzX0yE).
We take the time to train all our members before each competition and prepare in every way possible.


Other Ways You Can Help
You don't have to contribute to help us! Post this project on Facebook, Twitter, Reddit - anything you can think of to get the word out. 
If you or your organization possesses cybersecurity knowledge or resources, we would love to come and learn from you. Westview CyberSecurity is always trying to improve, and if you can help us in this regard, we would greatly appreciate it.
You can use the share tools on the project page to share quickly.

Westview CyberSecurity is currently sponsored by BAE Systems, ISPA Technology, Dennis Aleynikov, and David Anderson. We are immensely grateful for their support.

story:
An online and on demand training project

Por favor lê a versão portuguesa no final da página

 

You can make a difference in someone's life!

Tu podes fazer a diferença na vida de alguém!

 

 

  

WHO WE ARE

We believe that everyone has the right to education, regardless of their location, availability or financial conditions, and therefore we assume as our mission to facilitate such access.

 

WHERE DID WE GET THIS IDEA?

The ideia has born a few years ago, when Sofia moved to a smaller town. She is both a teacher and a student, and she experienced in first hand what is like to live and study in a smaller town. She had lived most of her life in a big city, and when she moved away from the capital she realized she had lost the power to choose which courses she would like to do. In the new town, there was no diversity and whenever there was some interesting course to do, it ended canceled for lack of participants.

This is the reality of most small towns. There is no specialized or qualified training  because there is no market for it. But we believe that education is a right, therefore we should all be entitled to educate ourselves in any subject, regardless of our location, or time availability of our financial condition and therefore we created REWINDD that aims to turn this right into a reality.

 

 

WHO NEEDS THIS? 

Everyone. A closer look at the training market has revealed profound gaps regarding to the offer. With the exception of big cities where we can find specific training and some diversity, the rest of the country, we find always the same titles.

The reality is that our training centers have no choice. The implementation of government programs to support education led to the opening of dozens of training centers, jostling each other on offering financed training. This situation has created unrealistic expectations about the price of the training. Nowadays people are more awake to the need to qualify but less ready to invest their own money in such training.

The companies were forced to reduce their offer to the National Qualifications Catalogue and within this, to a small range of courses for which they are able to join groups easily.

The training activities that do not fit in this context, end up developing in a parallel market, where the trainers themselves take the organization of training action at their own risk. In this case there is more variety, but still, there are many courses that fail to open because the promotor can not gather a group in a given zone or time.

Outside the major cities, this can be dramatic. If you want something different, more specific, you just can´t find it.

 

 

HOW WILL WE DO IT?  

REWINDD will make knowledge accessible to all. 

We are developing an on demand video training platform where students may access they prefered courses 24 hours a day, from anywhere.

We want to provide a training experience quite similar to the environment in the classroom. Courses are designed specifically for online environment and use techniques to assure the student feels just like the tranches is by his side. We seek to build a relationship between student and teacher although they might be miles away.

We will begin with important themes like personal finances, design, webdevelopment, tecnology, marketing, coaching, emotional inteligence, wellness and personal development courses because we recognize the need for it In the market. Still, we want to extend the training to other areas of knowledge quickly and for this we rely on the help of our future trainees who can leave suggestions on our website.

We pretend to take our learning platform to all Portuguese-speaking countries, like Angola, Brazil, Cape Verde, Guinea, Mozambique, S. Tome and Principe and East Timor and all portuguese communities out there.

REWINDD users will benefit from ...

  • Autonomy, they will no longer depend on others to have the oportunity to learn, because it would not be necessary to assemble a group with a common interest in these matters and availability for the same time and place.
  • Privacy, they can do it right from their couch
  • Pace, they can learn at their own pace. They may view and review the training videos as many times as they want to.
  • Availability, contents are available 24 hours a day, 365 days per week.
  • Freedom to start, stop and resume the course whenever they want without being limited to a predefined schedule that would be subject to the availability of the group, trainer and training room.
  • Mobility they may watch the course anywhere, they will only need a computer and internet access.
  • Diversity, the chance to find related courses that allow them to complement their training.
  • Niche contents, if we can find a trainer they will have the training no matter how specific the theme or area is.
  • Lower price, for the majority, absolutely free for those who can not afford it.
  • Privileged access to the trainer for inquiries.

 

 

WHAT WE CAN DO TOGETHER

By helping us, you are giving each studant the chance to study regardless of his location, availability or financial conditions. You can make a difference in someone's life.

 

 

WHAT HAVE WE DONE SO FAR?

We launched a year ago, a pilot experiment and the feedback was highly positive. Students who experienced the webdesign course we made available said:

I like to do things at my own pace, and here I have the chance for it.
I can review the videos as often as I want, backtrack, relearn from time to time and make the site on my time.
There are always those details that get lost in a classroom course, because we were focused to realize previous task, or because the phone rang at an important stage and we got distracted, or because we are tired. This model is easy. Just pause it, go for a sandwich and come back in exactly the place where we were with Sofia to join us.

Since then, we already have the developed the concept, designed the logo, and started developing the website. It's being built as we speak and we are already gathering the teaching team too. We already have someone in mind to produce the videos, still, we need the equipment and software for it.

 

 

WHAT WILL THE FUNDS BE USED FOR?

Our goal is to raise enough money to fund the first 12 months of REWINDD. After that the project should pay for itself.

We have the costs of developing the website, capturing and editing each course, as well as the costs of launching, expanding program and doing outreach for the next 12 months.  Now we need help to finish getting it ready to launch. Funds raised will be used to finish development, video capture and editing.

The funds will be used entirely for:

  • Scholarships, for students with no financial conditions  
  • Website development and hosting
  • Video / audio equipment and software
  • Volunteer stipends
  • Office rent
  • Indiegogo's cut

If we don’t reach our entire goal, the funds will go to:

  • Website hosting
  • Video / audio equipment and software
  • Indiegogo's cut

 

 

WHAT WILL YOU GET?

We have some great perks for you. You may get:

  • YOUR NAME OR COMPANY LOGO in our website as an official sponsor. You can sponsor an ebook, an on demand course, one of our authors, a category or the whole projet,
  • PUBLIC ACKNOWLEDGMENT on our facebook fans page,
  • REWINDD's DIGITAL PIN so you can use in your Facebook/Twitter profile photo,
  • THANK YOU CARD specially designed for our supporters.

 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Maybe you cannot contribute at this time, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. 
  • Share this campaign in Facebook, Twitter and Google Plus. Embeb it in your blog or send by mail to your friends. Let others know they can help too. 

 

 

About the team

The REWINDD team has more than 10 experience in classroom training and more than 15 years experience in webdesign and development. 

 

 

 

 

QUEM SOMOS?

Acreditamos que todos têm o direito à educação, independentemente da sua localização, disponibilidade ou condições financeiras e, portanto, assumimos como nossa missão facilitar esse acesso.

 

ONDE SURGIU A IDEIA?

A ideia surgiu há alguns anos, quando Sofia, se mudou para as Caldas da Rainha. Ela é formadora e uma eterna estudante, pelo que experimentou em primeira mão o que é viver e estudar numa cidade pequena. Sofia viveu a maior parte de sua vida em Lisboa, e quando se mudou percebeu que tinha perdido o poder de escolher os cursos que queria fazer. Não tinha diversidade e sempre que aparecia algum curso interessante para fazer, acabava cancelado por falta de participantes.

Esta é a realidade da maioria das cidades pequenas. Não há formação especializada ou qualificada, porque não há mercado para ela. Mas nós acreditamos que a educação é um direito, independentemente da nossa localização, disponibilidade  ou da nossa condição financeira e, por isso, criamos REWINDD que vem criar uma nova realidade.

 

 

QUEM PRECISA DISTO? 

Todos aqueles que gostam de aprender, de fazer formação contínua, demelhorar as suas competência e conhecimentos. Um olhar mais atento sobre o mercado de formação revelou lacunas profundas no que diz respeito à oferta.

Com excepção feita aos grandes centros como Lisboa e Porto onde podemos encontrar formação específica e diversidade, no resto do país, encontramos mais do mesmo.

A realidade é que os centros de formação não têm alternativa. A implementação do programa de Novas Oportunidades levou à abertura de dezenas de centros de formação, que se acotovelam entre si na oferta de formação financiada. Esta situação criou expetativas irrealistas sobre o preço da formação. Hoje em dia as pessoas estão mais despertas para a necessidade de se qualificarem mas menos disponíveis para investir o seu próprio dinheiro nessa formação.

Na prática, isto obrigou as empresas do setor a reduzirem a sua oferta formativa ao Catálogo Nacional de Qualificações e dentro deste, a um pequeno leque de cursos para os quais conseguem formar turmas com facilidade.

As ações de formação que não se enquadram neste contexto, acabam por se desenvolver num mercado paralelo, onde os próprios formadores assumem a organização da ação por sua conta e risco. Neste caso há mais variedade, mas ainda assim, há muitos cursos que não passam do papel porque não se consegue reunir um grupo numa determinada zona ou horário.

Fora das grandes cidades, isto pode ser dramático. Ao contrário do que se julga, isto não afecta apenas o interior e as ilhas. Cidades litorais como as Caldas da Rainha e até capitais de distrito como Faro, sofrem do mesmo mal.

 

COMO É QUE O VAMOS FAZER?  

A REWINDD vai tornar o conhecimento acessível a todos. Estamos a desenvolver uma plataforma de formação de vídeo on demand, onde os formandos podem aceder aos cursos de 24 horas por dia, em qualquer lugar.

Queremos proporcionar uma experiência de formação bastante semelhante à sala de aula. Os cursos são desenhados especificamente para um ambiente online e usam técnicas específicas para assegurar que o aluno se sente como se tivesse o formador ao seu lado. Procuramos construir uma relações de empatia entre aluno e professor, apesar da distância.

Vamos lançar a plataforma com cursos nas áreas de finanças pessoais, design, web development, tecnologia, marketing, coaching, inteligência emocional, bem-estar e desenvolvimento pessoal, porque reconhecemos a necessidade para este temas no mercado. Ainda assim, pretendemos alargar a formação a outras áreas de conhecimento rapidamente e para isso contamos com a ajuda de nossos formandos que podem deixar sugestões no site.

Pretendemos levar a nossa plataforma de aprendizagem a todos os países de língua portuguesa como Angola, Brasil, Cabo Verde, Guiné, Moçambique, S. Tomé e Principe e Timor Leste e às comunidades portuguesas espalhadas por esse mundo fora.

Os utilizadores REWINDD vão beneficiar de ...

  • Autonomia, deixam de estar dependentes de terceiros.
  • Privacidade, podem fazer o curso no conforto da sua casa
  • Ritmo, podem aprender ao seu ritmo, ver e rever os vídeos quantas vezes quiserem.
  • Disponibilidade, os conteúdos estão disponíveis 24 horas por dia, 365 dias por semana.
  • Liberdade, para iniciar, interromper e retomar o curso quando quiserem, sem terem de se sujeitar a um cronograma pré-definido que numa versão presencial seria condicionado à disponibilidade do grupo, formador e sala de formação. 
  • Mobilidade, podem ver o curso em qualquer lugar.
  • Diversidade, formação em áreas relacionadas e complementares.
  • Nichos, conteúdos específicos que não encontram no mercado convencional porque a necessidade de reunir um grupo com interesse nesses temas e com disponibilidade para um mesmo horário e local, os inviabiliza.
  • Baixo preço, para a maioria, absolutamente grátis para aqueles que não podem pagar.
  • Acesso privilegiado ao formador para esclarecimento de dúvidas.

 

 

O QUE PODEMOS FAZER JUNTOS?

Juntos podemos dar a oportunidade a cada formando de fazer a formação que precisa independentemente da região onde vive, da sua disponibilidade em termos de horário e das suas condições financeiras. juntos, podemos fazer a diferença na vida de alguém!

 

 

O QUE FIZÉMOS ATÉ AGORA?

Lançámos há um ano atrás, uma experiência piloto e o feedback foi muito positivo. Os alunos que fizeram o curso webdesign que disponibilizámos disseram:

Eu gosto de fazer as coisas ao meu ritmo, e aqui tenho a chance para isso.
Posso rever os vídeos quantas vezes quiser, voltar atrás, ver de novo de vez em quando e fazer o site no meu tempo.
Há sempre aqueles detalhes que se perdem na sala de aula, porque estávamos focados na tarefa anterior, porque o telefone tocou ou porque estamos cansados. Neste modelo é fácil. Basta pausar, ir buscar uma sanduíche e voltar exatamente ao lugar onde estávamos com Sofia.

Desde então, desenvolvemos o conceito, desenhámos o logotipo, e começámos a desenvolver o site. Já estamos a reunir a equipa pedagógica e já temos alguém em mente para a produção dos vídeos. Precisamos agora de equipamento e software para aedição de vídeo e audio.

 

 

PARA O QUE VAI SER USADO O DINHEIRO?

O nosso objetivo é reunir fundos suficientes para financiar os primeiros 12 meses da REWINDD. Depois disso o projeto pagar-se-à a si próprio.

Temos como custos o desenvolvimento do site, a captura e edição dos videos de cada curso, bem como os custos de lançamento, expansão e divulgação para os próximos 12 meses. Agora precisamos de ajuda para terminar e lançar o projeto. Os recursos captados serão utilizados para finalizar o desenvolvimento do site, captura e edição de vídeo.

Os fundo recolhidos vão ser usados:

  • Bolsas de estudos, para alunos sem condições financeiras  
  • Desenvolvimento e alojamento do site
  • Equipamento e software de edição de audio e vídeo
  • Despesas de voluntários
  • Aluguer de espaço para as gravações
  • Comissões do Indiegogo

Se não conseguirmos a totalidade, o que for recolhido será usado:

  • No alojamento do site
  • Equipamento e software de edição de audio e vídeo
  • Comissões do Indiegogo

 

 

O QUE RECEBES EM TROCA?

Temos uns miminhos para quem nos ajudar:

  • Divulgação do TEU NOME / EMPRESA / MARCA como patrocinador oficial. Podes patrocininar um ebook, um curso, um autor, toda umacategoria ou o projeto na sua totalidade,
  • RECONHECIMENTO PÚBLICO na nossa página no facebook como apoiante do projeto,
  • DIGITAL PIN da REWINDD para poderes usar no teu perfil no Facebook ou Twitter,
  • CARTÃO DE AGRADECIMENTO especialmente desenhado para quem acarinhou o projeto.

 

 

OUTRAS FORMAS DE AJUDAR

Talvez não possas contribuir neste momento, mas isso não quer dizer que não possas ajudar:

  • Por favor, passa a palavra e faz um pouco de barulho sobre a nossa campanha. 
  • Partilha esta campanha no Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus, no teu blog ou manda por mail para os teus amigos. Deixa que os outros saibam que podem ajudar também.

 

 

Sobre a equipa

A equipa da REWINDD tem mais de 10 de experiência em formação presencial e mais de 15 anos de experiência em webdesign.
