 24/7 available. 
Preview: Dutch




The ImpactWine Training Online is already available in Dutch, German and English language and will be available in Chinese language on a separate platform. E-Learning | Game Learning and Mobile Learning have a number of strengths apart from the ‘entertainment’ aspect:




By presenting certain information and/or skills as games, we make it fun to learn, discover, and
experience. The user stays motivated and will retain new knowledge longer.



Everyone can gain knowledge and experience at their own pace.



Every user receives customised information and feedback. The learning method is unconventional and has been proven to work.


The games are created by a team of experienced game designers and experts in learning methods and education.


The contents of a programme should of course fit learning goal(s) and contain the desired knowledge and interactive possibilities.


Visual design plays an important role. The games are appealing and, because of their professional interface, users will instantly know what they are supposed to do.








If you like this fund but you are not a wine lover, There are other Ways You Can Help...

 If you like this fund but you are not a wine lover... Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: 
Send Winetraining Online giftbox to a college -friend or familie "Wine lover" 
Just support us to reach our goals and and participate for EUR 7,50 You can share this with your friend on social media and the Indiegogo share tools! 
 I really thank you for your support! Ruud Weterings RV

story:
Short Summary

How much do you hate having wet, cold feet on a rainy day? Well imagine your toes being cold all day and you are unable to have a hot shower or huddle around a fireplace!

We know people have Syria-war fatigue and sometimes we feel the same. But remember that behind the war lies many innocent victims caught up in it. 

This is a personal initiative to help Syrian refugees face the harsh winter months ahead. After having personally witnessed the terrible conditions many Syrian in the Lebanon's Bekaa Valley endure, which will only get worst as winter gets colder, a bunch of us (ordinary citizens) felt compelled to help. 

The one thing refugees don't get from aid agencies are clothes including winter boots and this is an area we can help in having done it before.


What We Need & What You Get

We plan to fundraise enough money to buy warm jackets and boots for every child in a chosen settlement in the Bekaa Valley in Lebanon. 

We have very little time to fundraise as we hope to distribute by mid December before snow arrives to this area in Lebanon, last year, storm Alexa buried the area in few centimetres of snow. This year winter started early and it's expected to be colder. 

$7-$10 dollars is the cost of a warm jacket. 

$10-$15 is the cost of warm waterproof boots. 

For $4000 we will dress all 222 children under the age of 10 living in this particularly bad settlement, boots and jackets. 

If we raise more we will work to help all 547 people in this settlement! 

We have set a lower target on this page so we can reach it and pay less in fees to this website, but the higher we raise the more people we can help. 


PERKS: The only perk we can offer is that we will pay the admin cost of fundraising on this website, WHICH IS LESS IF WE REACH OUR TARGET! and we will pay all transport costs and other things you don't want your money wasted on. 

WHEN WE SAY YOUR MONEY WILL GO INTO CLOTHES AND BOOTS ONLY, WE MEAN IT!


The Impact

Some of us spent an hour in one of those damp tents in the video and our bones were aching all day from the cold. To say that refugees will suffer this winter is an understatement. Two Syrian toddlers have already died from cold conditions in Lebanon in the past month.

Distributions are chaotic and a hassle to do and having done one in 2012, we didn't think we will re-open this chapter again. But seeing this year's conditions was a wake up call. This is not about us or our comfort this is about the refugees. 

You have all seen the bad headlines and this is an opportunity for you and us to do something and not just turn off the TV and ignore. 


Risks & Challenges

We have successfully done a similar distribution before, in December 2012. https://www.facebook.com/helpsyrianrefugeesthiswinter 

We buy the clothes from a local factory. They are of good quality and come at the cheapest price possible. 

We can provide receipts for money spent and a breakdown of where the money has gone as well as photos and videos of the distribution. 

Our challenge here is getting the funds to order the clothes and distribute them as soon as possible. Winter has already arrived here!


Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand if you can't contribute at this stage yourself but please spread the word and share the campaign page with your family and friends. 

When we did this last time, the most humbling thing was the number of people who contributed on trust without knowing us personally. This was all thanks to others bringing the campaign to their attention. Please help us spread the word.

https://www.facebook.com/helpsyrianrefugeesthiswinter

story:
Out of the more than 15,000 primary schools in Haiti, only a handful have a garden— even though each year fewer and fewer students get a hot meal at school. With my colleagues at the Smallholder Farmers Alliance (SFA), we are sponsoring the establishment of a three-acre school garden and fruit orchard next to the “Ecole Mixte Fondamentale de Missy Dossous” in the Haitian farming community of St. Michel de l’Attalaye.

The good news is that the cost of installing and managing the garden and orchard is totally covered by SFA, students and teachers are pledged to help tend both, and the Missy Dossous School (shown below) is donating the land.  The vegetables and fruit grown will be used in the school’s hot meal program, and we hope the garden will become an inspiration and example to other schools around the country.

The bad news is that the school’s private funding has fallen through at the last minute for textbooks and uniforms for the 2014/2015 academic year.

The school is private, like 90 percent of all schools in Haiti, and a charitable foundation in Europe covers teachers’ salaries and other basic costs so that the poor farm families in the area pay very little tuition. However, there is an unforeseen shortfall of US$16,000 for textbooks and uniforms, neither of which parents can afford. The Missy Dossous School has 357 students (in both kindergarten and primary level), is registered with the government of Haiti, has an exceptionally high rating in state-administered exams, and is considered one of the three best schools in the region.

SFA is sponsoring the establishment and maintenance of the combined garden and fruit orchard (site shown in photo below, prior to start), along with the additional cost of a new environmental education curriculum. 

We are hoping you will consider pitching in to help pay for the textbooks and uniforms (like the ones below, shown from two years ago) for the students who will be tending the garden.

Why Uniforms?

You may wonder why uniforms are such a big deal, but I would just explain that virtually every school in Haiti requires their students to wear uniforms. Even in a very poor and rather remote area like St. Michel de l'Attalaye, kids don’t feel they are in a 'proper' school without wearing a uniform. It also takes pressure off parents who would otherwise need to buy more clothes for their children.

What is Needed

Campaign Goal: $16,000

All funds raised will go directly to the Missy Dossous School’s bank account in Haiti to be used for:

  • Textbooks and supplies: $9,600 
  • Uniforms: $6,400

The first priority will be purchasing textbooks and supplies (notebooks, pencils, etc.), and, as additional funds are raised, the uniforms will be the second priority.

None of the funds raised will go to the Smallholder Farmers Alliance. It will all go directly to the school (kindergarten shown below).

Timing

School in Haiti is scheduled to start September 8, but the reality is that it usually gets underway by mid-October. Work has already begun on the school garden (which is fully paid for) and it will be operational by the end of September. The goal is to have raised the funds for the textbooks and uniforms by late October.

Accountability

I will be personally monitoring the expenditure of the funds raised and will produce a full accounting, with receipts attached, for anyone who wants a copy.

More About Us

Although this campaign is to raise money for the Missy Dossous School, you can learn more about the Smallholder Farmers Alliance from the following CNN profile of our work.

story:
My mission...
As most of you know, I'm currently on a mission to deliver food, medical and school supplies, clothes, toys and bed nets to orphans in eastern DRC as well as raise money to send them to school. Many people keep asking me how they can support this project or make a donation if they didn't get chance to first time around so I'm re-launching the fundraising project for 1 week. This is perfect timing as most of the money we originally raised has already been spent on food, medical supplies as well as sending some orphans to school. Any donations would be gratefully received. The fundraising will close in 1 week though as I need to know how much I have to spend in my final week here so get your donations in quick!


A little more info...
DRC, or the Democratic Republic of Congo, as it is officially known, lies in the heart of Sub-Saharan Africa. It is one of the poorest countries in the world and has the highest rates of malnutrition and child mortality. Years of conflict between the Congolese Army and different rebel groups have ravaged the country, particularly in the east where DRC borders Uganda and Rwanda. This conflict has claimed more than five million lives making it the planet's deadliest war since World War II. In addition to the conflict, crippling poverty, corrupt governments, widespread HIV/AIDS and the world's highest rates of rape has resulted in over 4 million orphans. While the local communities do what they can to provide for these orphans and other vulnerable children, they still remain in desperate need of the most basic provisions such as food, clean water and medical services as well as education.


My trip so far...
I've been in eastern DRC for 3 weeks now and have spent that time working in Bunia, Beni, Butembo and Rwese. I have visited a number of different orphanages as well as schools, clinics and both church and women's groups that help orphans here. Most of the project money that we raised has been spent on food as that always seems to be the thing they need most when we arrive at a place although I have also bought medical supplies for clinics that will now treat the orphans for free and donated $1,160 to the Rwese orphanage so they could send 29 of their children to school. 


The most fun though has been giving out the clothes and toys that many people in the UK kindly donated before I left. These orphans have nothing and their clothes (if they are wearing any) are literally rags full of holes. Putting clean t-shirts and other clothes on them makes such a difference.



Where does the project go from here?
I've got 3 days left in Beni before I fly south to visit Goma and Bukavu. What I'd really like to do before I go is buy mattresses for all the orphanages where children are having to sleep on wooden bed frames or worse, on the bare floor. This photo of a bedroom I took at one orphanage is where 28 children sleep, sometimes 6 little ones in 1 single bed with no mattress.



I'd also like to be able to cover the costs of getting little Roda the medical attention she needs to make her walk as I can't even begin to think what her life is going to be like if we don't find a way to help her.



As always, I'd really like to be able to buy food for these children, especially milk for the babies and continue to send those that can't afford the fees to school.



How can you help?

1. Make a donation...
Before I left the UK people generously donated clothes, shoes and toys for the orphans and a number of different companies donated school exercise books, pencils, crayons and mosquito nets. A number of people also generously supported the project by making a financial donation.

These orphans need food, milk powder for babies, medications (such as de-worming tablets) and mattresses to sleep on. If anyone would like to make a donation so that I can buy more of these items for the orphans then I'd be incredibly grateful.

2. Sponsor a child to get an education...
Half of all children in DRC do not attend school because they can't afford the £25 per year school fees and for orphans this number goes up to 100% in some areas. Thanks to generous donations of my friends in the UK, 29 orphans in Rwese orphanage are now able to go to school but there are many more who can't. If you would like to make a donation of £25 to send a child to school that would be amazing. 

Alternatively, once I return to the UK I will be setting up a system whereby you can have a monthly direct debit to spread the cost of sending an orphan to school over the whole year. If you would prefer to do this please email me at: oranguhan@gmail.com.


Follow my journey ...
Please visit my facebook page: www.facebook.com/missioncongo and like Mission Congo to show your support
Follow my blog: www.mission-congo.blogspot.co.uk to keep updated with the project and find out how your support is helping change the lives of orphans in DRC.

Thanks!

story: My name is Tommy. I have a band called The Lifters based in Austin, Tx. I was looking for was to help raise money for St. Jude when I realized I had a small surplus of our last CD. Since most music is sold as downloads (ours included) I started thinking. If someone donates to the cause  ($15 and over) I'll send them a CD. $10 go's to St. Jude, the $5 is to us for P&H. Right now it's USA only. This may seem wild and unorthodox but I think it may work even in a small way. Please don't let the scruffy look of the CD cover turn you off, the songs are much worse. This is a well received CD and although It may not be for everyone some have found the lucky charms hidden in it. The bottom line is... help the kids, we're trying, so I hope you will as well. For more info on us look here Http://thelifters.net

story:
Kerb 22 needs your support and help to print our journal. Kerb is a progressive design journal focussed on contemporary landscape architecture issues from an international and national perspective. The journal is unique in being compiled and edited each year by a group of interested students from RMIT University’s School of Architecture and Design. Content of the journal is based upon themes relevant to current practices and projects of landscape architecture. The thematic of each publication can be interpreted by multiple disciplines and as such a variety of disciplines may be included within the journal.

This will be Kerb’s 22nd year in production, and we are actively spreading the word about this years topic, ‘Remoteness’. We aim to challenge and explore the context of remoteness with submissions encouraged from landscape architecture, design, and broader practices.

Every contributor will receive a personalised invitation to our launch party on August 15th in Melbourne, Australia, as well as some other goodies! By helping student publication, you are fostering the voices of future design and the conviction that design has the potential to enrich the diversity of our urban landscape.

Every donation counts, and even if we don’t reach our entire goal, every cent will still be put back into Kerb.

In the past Kerb Journal has received wide critical acclaim and been exhibited internationally in cities such as London, New York and Milan as part of the Archizines World Tour collection. Last years edition of Kerb featured Marina Abramovic, Christophe Girot, Estudi Marti Franch, Lateral Office, Lucy McRae and ReD Associates amongst others.

We understand not everyone can afford to make a cash donation, but there are loads of other ways to support Kerb! Share our campaign with all of your friends, using the links below.


For more information about Kerb, please visit:

kerbjournal.com

facebook.com/kerbjournal

story:
Hello! My name is Shelby Nicole T. and I want to build giant monsters! I'm a 22 year old with a dream of getting into the special effect industry! Since I could remember, I loved monsters. Godzilla, Jurassic Park, Dragonheart. I don't think I ever had a barbie growing up as a kid! I am finally on my way to getting my dream career, but I need your help! As you can see, I'm a little Godzilla crazy.


So what's all the hubbub?

The Stan Winston School is allowing 12 students to participate in person for their class 'How to build a Kaiju" This class is a 15 full day course taught by some of the big names in the Special Effects/ Practical Effects industry. By getting to go to this class, I can push my own career forward in the direction I want it to go! Making big giant monsters has been a dream of mine since I was a kid, however I really need some help getting closer to my dream!

Why do you need help?

I recently moved to Louisiana to join a special effect school down here. Sadly, this school only lasts 7 weeks. It has given me the basics to be able to get a job in the industry, but I'm hungry for more knowledge!

I am constantly working just to pay for my rent down here in Louisiana, and I can not raise the funds I need in time to be able to attend this class out in California and keep a roof over my head.  I will be able to pay for basic things, like food and miscellaneous expenses, but I need help for the bulk of it!

What will you do with my money?

I have put the bare minimum down on what I need to attend this course. The course itself is $2000 and sadly that doesn't include travel and boarding costs. Because I do not live in California, I will need to use some of this money for an extended stay hotel which will add up roughly to $2000 for the 15 days I attend this class. I will need a round trip plane ticket to CA, which will cost anywhere from $400 - $700 depending and another expense is car rental, which will be around $800. Finally, I need the gas money to drive to Texas so I can let my parents keep watch over my dogs while I'm gone! The rest of the money will go to any unexpected expenses that happen to pop up, as they do in almost any traveling situation

Risks

If I am unable to attend this course, I will use whatever money I have earned and will put it towards supplies to learn this stuff myself, and getting out all the perks for you amazing people!

 your help! As you can see, I'm a little Godzilla crazy.So what's all the hubbub?The
 Stan Winston School is allowing 12 students to participate in person 
for their class 'How to build a Kaiju" This class is a 15 full day 
course taught by some of the big names in the Special Effects/ Practical
 Effects industry. By getting to go to this class, I can push my own 
career forward in the direction I want it to go! Making big giant 
monsters has been a dream of mine since I was a kid, however I really 
need some help getting closer to my dream!Why do you need help?I recently moved to Louisiana to 
join a special effect school down here. Sadly, this school only lasts 7 
weeks. It has given me the basics to be able to get a job in the 
industry, but I'm hungry for more knowledge!I am constantly 
working just to pay for my rent down here in Louisiana, and I can not 
raise the funds I need in time to be able to attend this class out in 
California and keep a roof over my head.  I will be able to pay for 
basic things, like food and miscellaneous expenses, but I need help for 
the bulk of it!What will you do with my money?I have put the bare 
minimum down on what I need to attend this course. The course itself is 
$2000 and sadly that doesn't include travel and boarding costs. Because I
 do not live in California, I will need to use some of this money for an
 extended stay hotel which will add up roughly to $2000 for the 15 days I
 attend this class. I will need a round trip plane ticket to CA, which 
will cost anywhere from $400 - $700 depending and another expense is 
car rental, which will be around $800. Finally, I need the gas money to 
drive to Texas so I can let my parents keep watch over my dogs while I'm
 gone! The rest of the money will go to any unexpected expenses that 
happen to pop up, as they do in almost any traveling situationRisksIf I am unable to attend this course, I will use whatever money I have earned and will put it towards supplies to learn this stuff myself, and getting out all the perks for you amazing people!

story:
Short Summary

 I'm raising money for my very first cross country mission trip. I am going with Liberty University since I am a freshmen here.

This trip is extremely important to me, since it is my first ever mission trip to another country. The trip will leave December, 27- january, 11. The mission trip is going to the middle east, although, I can't say where due to security, and safety reasons.

I hope to be able to bring and share my religion, with a country that is 99% muslim.

What We Need

The trip it's self costs $ 3500 and that does not include immunizations and other miscellaneous items that will be needed for my trip.

The $ 3500 will go towards the costs of the actual trip the rest of the money I raise will go towards getting vaccinations and other people in my group. 

    Other You Can Help

    we will need many prayers going over to this region of the world.  Please keep our entire group in your prayers as we get ready to embark on a fantastic trip.

story:
Who is Sorya?

Sorya is a nonprofit organization dedicated to support the people in rural Cambodia to shape their own future. We started in 2002 as a small school in the village Tropeang Sdock at the foot of the Chisor Mountain. Today, in 2015, Sorya maintains two schools and approximately 500 students visit our classes per day. We have ten Cambodian team members who spend their time and talents toward achieving Sorya’s goals of Honesty, Liberty, Friendship & Happiness.

Since Sorya is already active in rural Cambodia for more than 10 years; we understand the high demand for nurseries like Viola's Yard. Currently, mostly mothers stay at home taking care of the kids that are too young for elementary school. Therefore, they are unable to contribute to their families' financial income. With Viola's Yard in place, Sorya is now providing the first nursery in the whole commune. It is an important step for women's rights, child education and the community.

Now we need your support to purchase the furniture and other equipment for our newly founded Kindergarten "Viola's Yard"!


Why the equipment is urgently needed?

With the end of the construction of our new building "Mila's Villekulla" on November 24, Sorya will now have sufficient space to host the numerous children that are now waiting for the start of Sorya's long planned Kindergarten.

- Mila's Villekulla is ready -

Since the demand for the nursery was constantly very high, we decided to start the classes as soon as possible but as you can imagine, the regular desks are a lot too high for children between the age of 3 and 5.

- The first kids of the kindergarten -

But most importantly, we do not intend to only instruct the kids but the classes are supposed to be a lot of fun. The current caregiver of the Kindergarten Srey Leak proposed to purchase games to play inside and outside as well as sport equipment.

What is still needed for Viola's Yard?

  • A set of 60 little desks for painting and other indoor activities
  • 4 blackboards
  • A set of robust sports equipment for outdoor group activities
  • Indoor games such as puzzles, toy blocks, picture books etc.
With your support we can provide Tropeang Sdock and the whole community with a high quality nursery school and make Viola's Yard a reputable institution.

Visit us & Share

Money is of course not the only way you can support us with. Feel free to visit us in Cambodia and take part in our unique Homestay experience. Sitha, our colleague studying Tourism, will show you around the beautiful countryside of southern Cambodia.

Last but not least, please share this campaign with your friends. You can also do so by simply clicking on the Facebook, Twitter or Google Logo on the left side of your screen.

story:
Short Summary

#BlackLivesMatter-TO is creating educational resources for #BlackLivesMatter Freedom School, a 3 week long summer program for children aged 4-10 running this July.  Freedom School is a response to a lack of humanizing, self-affirming, queer positive educational opportunities for Black children in the GTA.  The money raised by this campaign will pay Black artists to create much needed educational resources for young children that teach Black Canadian and diasporic history.

What kind of Educational Resources?

The lack of educational materials for children aged 4-10 that teach about Black Canadian and diasporic history is glaring, so we need to make it!  The Freedom School Committee will be working with Black Artists and allies to develop everything from Virtual Reality to Claymations to colouring books and beyond, covering topics like the Haitian Revolution to Sins Invalid to the #BlackLivesMatter Movement.  We intend to pay Black artists for their labour, while creating engaging and relevant new resources for students at Freedom School.

$25 will pay for the production of 1 Freedom School Workbook

$50 will pay for the materials to make a Black liberation leaders memory game

$150 will pay for the Black liberation advent calendar production

$300 will pay for an art piece about a historical event for a Black liberation timeline

$1000 will pay for translating our video resources to ASL

$2000 will pay material costs for a short video about the Bussa Revolution


More about #BlackLivesMatter Freedom School

#BlackLivesMatter Freedom School is a 3 week long summer program proposed for the summer of 2016 for children aged 4-10.  The purpose of the project is to respond to a lack of humanizing, self-affirming, queer positive educational opportunities for Black children in the GTA.  Freedom school will provide an alternative setting for parents who do not feel that our children are being taught self-love, and a passion for justice and liberation through their formal education.  The program is designed to teach children about Black Canadian and diasporic history, to engage children in political resistance to anti-Black racism and state violence through a trans-feminist lens, and to offer children an entry point into the #BlackLivesMatter movement.  #BlackLivesMatter Freedom School is designed to support children and families living and growing in a reality of witnessing police violence in our communities.  It is designed to support parent and youth voice through the development of a parent and youth advisory boards, that will help to guide the project.  

Through offering access to free childcare for young children, hot meals and bussing, #BlackLivesMatter freedom school will be geared towards families from working class neighbourhoods/contexts.  This is an acknowledgement that anti-Black racism and police violence and intrinsically connected to classism and poverty.  

Through collaborating with visual artists and musicians, freedom school with explore art and technology as tools of resistance.  It will provide access for children who may not otherwise have access to materials and skills such as printmaking, and child friendly design apps.  Children will be exposed to artists such as Nikki Giovanni, Elizabeth Catlett and Emory Douglas who were a part of the Black Arts Movement- the artistic branch of the Black Power Movement in the 1960s.  The project will culminate in political action to be determined and designed by the participants.  It will also conclude with a street gallery, which with amplify childrens’ voices as they forge their entry into the #BlackLivesMatter Movement.  


The above piece is called Incendiary: Marie-Joseph Angelique, and is by Kit Lang, a textile artist based in Toronto.   Through this campaign, more pieces about Black History  by Black artists will be funded.  More from Kit Lang at http://kitlangfiberart.blogspot.ca/


Project Coordinator:  LeRoi Newbold is a parent, educator, steering committee member of #BlackLivesMatter- Toronto, and inaugural staff/teacher at Canada’s first public Africentric School.  With 10 years experience of experience in Africentric curriculum development and delivery, early childhood education and youth engagement, he will be drawing on his ability to engage students in pedagogy on Black liberation.  


Other ways to be involved

To  register for or support Freedom School through volunteering email: BlackLivesMatterTO@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
MiaoKids is a play-based learning system for children ages 2-8. Drawing on the theory of multiple intelligences and carefully constructed to foster logical processing, MiaoKids creates the perfect harmony between everyday learning and physical play. It helps kids make the connection between the abstract and concrete while being fun and interactive.

 

 

 The Upgrades in Version 2.0: 

  1.  Convenient Stand — Comes with the Wonder Stand, making it more convenient to prop up and use your smartphone or tablet. 
  2.  More Portable —  The upgraded Wonder Pad is now smaller and lighter, compared to the previous design.
  3.  Games Expansion — Expanded games with more levels and unique game modes.
  4.  English Module — New add-on English module that develops child's vocabulary and language intuition.
  5.  Logic Module — Helps kids build logic and reasoning skills.  
  6.  Upgraded Hardware — Quicker detections and a steadier connection to greatly improve the user experience.

 

 

Transforming How Children Learn

MiaoKids merges tactile exploration with innovative technology, thereby engaging children through a multi-sensory environment and adaptive curriculum. 

MiaoKids includes 4 types of tactile blocks(math/logic/shape/letters) that add an important kinesthetic/tactile element to graphics and sounds as part of our award-winning early literacy system. 

"The hands-on nature of the fun and learning brings a huge level of engagement that serves to anchor and reinforce the math and logic skills young learners so readily absorb from the app's enormously entertaining educational activities. " --  Tillywig Toy Award

 

 

 

The MiaoKids learning system is composed of three major elements—the app, the Pad, and the blocks. It's very easy to use. Just connect the Pad to your device and then play with our physical game pieces.

 

 

 

(1) MiaoKids App
 The MiaoKids’ apps are designed to nurture the learning interest of young children. It was designed by early education experts who studied at Harvard University. We currently have 3 individual apps (MiaoKids Logic, MiaoKids Wonder Math, and MiaoKids English) with more than 500 non-repetitive games included.

 

 

(2) MiaoKids Blocks/Cubes
 The blocks serve as the primary input mechanism for your child to interact with the on-screen games. There are 4 types of blocks: math, logic, shapes, and letters. They introduce a kinesthetic/tactile element to our learning ecosystem.

 

 

 

(3) MiaoKids Wonder Pad - The Wonder Pad ties everything together and serves as a communicative bridge between the App and Blocks/Cubes. 

 

 

How the MiaoKids System Works...

 

 

 

We dedicate ourselves to providing meaningful, fun learning experiences through incorporating tangible pieces that your child could feel and touch. MiaoKids comes with over 500 curriculum-mapped lesson plans, useful as a supplement to education programs all over the world. It is the easiest way to introduce basic math and logic concepts in early stages of learning.

 

Beginning learners love to play and explore with our multisensory learning games! The games are FREE to download —with more coming soon.

 

 

Hands-on Play With Numbers

With MiaoKids, kids will be arranging physical blocks, including mathematical signs and digits. Our apps instruct them on learning various concepts by assembling the correct assortment of blocks. Kids can play and engage with math without the pressure of time or the fear of getting the wrong answer. MiaoKids' real-time feedback allows kids to learn through experimentation in a stress-free environment, thereby helping them to build confidence.

 

Our suite of applications are designed for children ages 2-8.
 

Math Adventure Mode — helps kids track everyday progress of learning.

 

 

Creative problem-solving

MiaoKids helps children realize that there are multiple ways to solve problems and gives them the opportunity to select the method that works best for them.  This enables them to understand how something works and can then apply it to a variety of other problems later.

 

 

Designed for ages 2-8

There are math concepts (counting, addition, multiplication, etc.) suitable for everyone. As kids become more confident in one mode, they can move on to the next, allowing them to learn at their own pace.

MiaoKids Logic and Wonder Math become increasingly complex and interesting with each grade-level. The chart below describes some of the skills that await your child’s development. 

 

 

 

More games to come

Our portfolio of applications is constantly expanding, and we look forward to bringing even more subjects and learning content to you soon! For more footages of Math gameplay, visit our YouTube channel or download our free MiaoKids Math application. 

 

 

 

We have expanded our math curriculum through the inclusion of another app that hosts a variety of logic games designed to expand and exercise kids' logical reasoning and critical thinking. Logic problems present children the opportunity to think through and analyze different solutions, enabling them to realize that there exists many methods to solve a situation. Each problem encourages children to tap into their past knowledge and incorporate them in novel and original ways.

 

 

 

Build Logical Connections Between Things

Younger children base their understanding of the world on what they see and hear, relying less so on logic. MiaoKids helps them to make connections between the shapes and objects, names of numbers and quantities they represent, etc. We encourage children to compare hands-on experiences utilizing charts and graphs to deeply analyze different scenarios.

 

Identify shapes and objects

 

 

Understand Application of Everyday Experiences

Kindergartners are developing the ability to hold information in their minds and drawing upon it to make comparisons. This is a sign of kids straddling the fence between concrete and abstract representations. With MiaoKids logic games, kids can begin to understand how to apply theory to everyday experiences.

 

For more footages of Logic gameplay, visit our YouTube channel or download our free MiaoKids Logic application.

 

 

 

 

Our MiaoKids English letter blocks and application function as a personalized English tutor. The app provides a robust curriculum that gradually scales in difficulty and helps to develop your child's vocabulary and language intuition. Children advance through the curriculum with continuous assessments that track their game progress and performance.

 

 

Why the English module

Give your child a head start in honing their linguistic aptitude while harnessing the additional cognitive capacities that your child is already developing.

  • 85% of the neurological connections for language learning develop before age seven.[1]
  • Early exposure to language impacts learning.
  • MiaoKids supports reading readiness in children ages 2-8.

 

 

Here are skills that MiaoKids enhances...

  • Letter identification
  • Phonemic sounds
  • Word construction
  • Word families
  • Word onsets
  • Vocabulary
  • Lower case letters
  • Print concepts
  • Spelling
  • Tracing and writing

 

*Please note that the English Learning Kit is an add-on that DOES NOT include the Wonder Pad. It is designed to complement the MiaoKids Standard Kit, which includes the Pad.  

 

 

Both the Smart Kit and Wonder Math have been well-received professionally with 11 industry awards, including Academics’ Choice, Tillywig, and Red Dot.

 

 

Given the success we’ve experienced in the past few years, we want to spread the MiaoKids joy to the entire world. This Kickstarter is the first step towards that aspiration.

 

 

We can say with confidence that an ever important skill is mathematics. A better aptitude for math will help children develop the computational capacity necessary to understand the future that has grown increasingly reliant on computer science and information systems. With MiaoKids, your child will be given concrete representations of mathematical and logical concepts.

 

 

Our endearing characters and colorful world will ensure that your child is properly stimulated through auditory and visual means. The Wonder Blocks/Cubes provide stimulation to another important sense, touch, and ultimately round out our play-based learning system.

 

Video provided by Heena Nurmuhammed, Parenting Blogger from London.

 

A Play-Based Game Mechanism

Students engage the world around them in a host of ways. The MiaoKids ecosystem is constructed around the notion that play-based learning serves as an immensely valuable – and often underutilized – component of a child’s education. Recent research suggests that well-structured play-based learning experiences can yield a positive effect in language development and related arenas.[2]

 

 

What does this mean for us at MiaoKids? Our goal is to keep learning at the forefront and strive to supplement the learning experiences our community is already getting in the traditional classroom. We jam-pack our games with relevant content that will maintain our users’ attention and forge transferable skills. We also build our offerings in a way that invites social collaboration with peers. And finally, to be conscious of screen time health, we construct our physical materials in a way that allows for “away-from-the-app” use in more conventional play environments.

 

 

These are a few of our goals to get play-based learning right and make it better for all, and we welcome feedback from our users as we continue to refine what we have to offer.

 

Video provided by Tre Rubinsky, mom, former teacher.

 

A special thanks to our volunteers who have participated in our Facebook event and became our early testers! 

We're beyond grateful to have your assistance along the way, and we sincerely appreciate the valuable feedback and excellent footages of your MiaoKids experience. Thank you all so much!

 

Video provided by Alisanne Colkitt, blogger, mom, and former early childhood educator.

 

Video provided by Sondra Claflin, homeschool mom.

 

Video provided by Andrea Lim.

 

 

 

MiaoKids 2.0 is the fruit of collaboration between a group of like-minded professionals. Although each of us brings a diverse range of perspectives and skill sets, we share a common passion for improving early childhood education and tackling what we view as some of the most prevalent challenges in the field. 

This project serves as a culmination of our efforts to date. With your support, we promise to continue developing interactive technologies that will revolutionize early mathematical and logic education.

 

 

 

 

 

MiaoKids endeavors to incorporate the findings from renowned education theorists. We made a particular effort to draw from and implement Jean Piaget’s Zone of Proximal Development.

 

Piaget’s Zone of Proximal Development

Jean Piaget emphasizes the ​zone of proximal development​ (area labeled “learner can do with guidance”). It serves as a framework to understand the ideal difficulty of tasks that a learner should be engaged in. Some tasks are too easy, thus leaving the learners unchallenged. Other tasks might be too hard, making it impossible for the learner to grapple and disentangle the challenge. The zone of proximal development suggests that learners should ideally be presented with learning content somewhere in between, difficult enough to challenge the child but not overly difficult so that it ultimately becomes discouraging.

 

 

The MiaoKids system was designed with the zone of proximal development in mind. Our Wonder Math app presents your child with increasingly challenging problems tailored to their individual development. 

The exercises borrow from and build on the foundation of previous tasks to ensure a rich understanding through a process called scaffolding. Moreover helpful hints in the form of voice prompts and immediate feedback on correctness guide your child on their learning journey.

The MiaoKids ecosystem enriches your child’s cognitive development while being cost-effective. MiaoKids serves as a reliable companion to your child from toddler to grade school.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 
 

 

 
 

 

 

[1] Data derived from Council for Early Child Development (ref. Nash, 1997, Early Years Study, 1999, Shonkoff, 2000).

[2] Stagnitti, K., Bailey, A., Stevenson, E.H., Reynolds, E., & Kidd, E. (2015). An investigation into the effect of play-based instruction on the development of play skills and oral language. Journal of Early Childhood Research, 14(4), 389-406.

 Logic Module — Helps kids build logic and reasoning skills.  
 Upgraded Hardware — Quicker detections and a steadier connection to greatly improve the user experience.

 
A Standard MiaoKids Wonder Kit (No Add-on)

 
Transforming How Children Learn
MiaoKids merges tactile exploration with innovative technology, thereby engaging children through a multi-sensory environment and adaptive curriculum. 
MiaoKids includes 4 types of tactile blocks(math/logic/shape/letters) that add an important kinesthetic/tactile element to graphics and sounds as part of our award-winning early literacy system. 
"The hands-on nature of the fun and learning brings a huge level of engagement that serves to anchor and reinforce the math and logic skills young learners so readily absorb from the app's enormously entertaining educational activities. " --  Tillywig Toy Award
 
 
 
The MiaoKids learning system is composed of three major elements—the app, the Pad, and the blocks. It's very easy to use. Just connect the Pad to your device and then play with our physical game pieces.
 

 
 
(1) MiaoKids App The MiaoKids’ apps are designed to nurture the learning interest of young children. It was designed by early education experts who studied at Harvard University. We currently have 3 individual apps (MiaoKids Logic, MiaoKids Wonder Math, and MiaoKids English) with more than 500 non-repetitive games included.
 
 

 
(2) MiaoKids Blocks/Cubes The blocks serve as the primary input mechanism for your child to interact with the on-screen games. There are 4 types of blocks: math, logic, shapes, and letters. They introduce a kinesthetic/tactile element to our learning ecosystem.
 


 
 
(3) MiaoKids Wonder Pad - The Wonder Pad ties everything together and serves as a communicative bridge between the App and Blocks/Cubes. 
 


 
How the MiaoKids System Works...

 


 
 
We dedicate ourselves to providing meaningful, fun learning experiences through incorporating tangible pieces that your child could feel and touch. MiaoKids comes with over 500 curriculum-mapped lesson plans, useful as a supplement to education programs all over the world. It is the easiest way to introduce basic math and logic concepts in early stages of learning.
 
 

Beginning learners love to play and explore with our multisensory learning games! The games are FREE to download —with more coming soon.
 
 
Hands-on Play With Numbers
With MiaoKids, kids will be arranging physical blocks, including mathematical signs and digits. Our apps instruct them on learning various concepts by assembling the correct assortment of blocks. Kids can play and engage with math without the pressure of time or the fear of getting the wrong answer. MiaoKids' real-time feedback allows kids to learn through experimentation in a stress-free environment, thereby helping them to build confidence.
 
 

Our suite of applications are designed for children ages 2-8.
 

Math Adventure Mode — helps kids track everyday progress of learning.
 
 
Creative problem-solving
MiaoKids helps children realize that there are multiple ways to solve problems and gives them the opportunity to select the method that works best for them.  This enables them to understand how something works and can then apply it to a variety of other problems later.
 
 
 

 
Designed for ages 2-8
There are math concepts (counting, addition, multiplication, etc.) suitable for everyone. As kids become more confident in one mode, they can move on to the next, allowing them to learn at their own pace.
MiaoKids Logic and Wonder Math become increasingly complex and interesting with each grade-level. The chart below describes some of the skills that await your child’s development. 
 

 
 
More games to come
Our portfolio of applications is constantly expanding, and we look forward to bringing even more subjects and learning content to you soon! For more footages of Math gameplay, visit our YouTube channel or download our free MiaoKids Math application. 
 

 
 
We have expanded our math curriculum through the inclusion of another app that hosts a variety of logic games designed to expand and exercise kids' logical reasoning and critical thinking. Logic problems present children the opportunity to think through and analyze different solutions, enabling them to realize that there exists many methods to solve a situation. Each problem encourages children to tap into their past knowledge and incorporate them in novel and original ways.
 

 
 
Build Logical Connections Between Things
Younger children base their understanding of the world on what they see and hear, relying less so on logic. MiaoKids helps them to make connections between the shapes and objects, names of numbers and quantities they represent, etc. We encourage children to compare hands-on experiences utilizing charts and graphs to deeply analyze different scenarios.

 
Identify shapes and objects
 
 
Understand Application of Everyday Experiences
Kindergartners are developing the ability to hold information in their minds and drawing upon it to make comparisons. This is a sign of kids straddling the fence between concrete and abstract representations. With MiaoKids logic games, kids can begin to understand how to apply theory to everyday experiences.
 
 
 
Judging by appearances / make predictions
For more footages of Logic gameplay, visit our YouTube channel or download our free MiaoKids Logic application.
  

 
 
Our MiaoKids English letter blocks and application function as a personalized English tutor. The app provides a robust curriculum that gradually scales in difficulty and helps to develop your child's vocabulary and language intuition. Children advance through the curriculum with continuous assessments that track their game progress and performance.
 

 
Why the English module
Give your child a head start in honing their linguistic aptitude while harnessing the additional cognitive capacities that your child is already developing.

85% of the neurological connections for language learning develop before age seven.[1]
Early exposure to language impacts learning.
MiaoKids supports reading readiness in children ages 2-8.

 
 
 
For more footages of English gameplay, download our MiaoKids English application, which is available for free.
 
Here are skills that MiaoKids enhances...

Letter identification
Phonemic sounds
Word construction
Word families
Word onsets
Vocabulary
Lower case letters
Print concepts
Spelling
Tracing and writing


 
*Please note that the English Learning Kit is an add-on that DOES NOT include the Wonder Pad. It is designed to complement the MiaoKids Standard Kit, which includes the Pad.  
 

 
Both the Smart Kit and Wonder Math have been well-received professionally with 11 industry awards, including Academics’ Choice, Tillywig, and Red Dot.
 

 
Given the success we’ve experienced in the past few years, we want to spread the MiaoKids joy to the entire world. This Kickstarter is the first step towards that aspiration.
 


 
We can say with confidence that an ever important skill is mathematics. A better aptitude for math will help children develop the computational capacity necessary to understand the future that has grown increasingly reliant on computer science and information systems. With MiaoKids, your child will be given concrete representations of mathematical and logical concepts.
 

 
Our endearing characters and colorful world will ensure that your child is properly stimulated through auditory and visual means. The Wonder Blocks/Cubes provide stimulation to another important sense, touch, and ultimately round out our play-based learning system.
 

Video provided by Heena Nurmuhammed, Parenting Blogger from London.
 A Play-Based Game Mechanism
Students engage the world around them in a host of ways. The MiaoKids ecosystem is constructed around the notion that play-based learning serves as an immensely valuable – and often underutilized – component of a child’s education. Recent research suggests that well-structured play-based learning experiences can yield a positive effect in language development and related arenas.[2]
 

 
What does this mean for us at MiaoKids? Our goal is to keep learning at the forefront and strive to supplement the learning experiences our community is already getting in the traditional classroom. We jam-pack our games with relevant content that will maintain our users’ attention and forge transferable skills. We also build our offerings in a way that invites social collaboration with peers. And finally, to be conscious of screen time health, we construct our physical materials in a way that allows for “away-from-the-app” use in more conventional play environments.
 

 
These are a few of our goals to get play-based learning right and make it better for all, and we welcome feedback from our users as we continue to refine what we have to offer.
 

Video provided by Tre Rubinsky, mom, former teacher.

 
A special thanks to our volunteers who have participated in our Facebook event and became our early testers! 
We're beyond grateful to have your assistance along the way, and we sincerely appreciate the valuable feedback and excellent footages of your MiaoKids experience. Thank you all so much!
 



Video provided by Alisanne Colkitt, blogger, mom, and former early childhood educator.
 

Video provided by Sondra Claflin, homeschool mom.
 

Video provided by Andrea Lim.
 



 

 
 
MiaoKids 2.0 is the fruit of collaboration between a group of like-minded professionals. Although each of us brings a diverse range of perspectives and skill sets, we share a common passion for improving early childhood education and tackling what we view as some of the most prevalent challenges in the field. 
This project serves as a culmination of our efforts to date. With your support, we promise to continue developing interactive technologies that will revolutionize early mathematical and logic education.
 

 
 

 


 
 
MiaoKids endeavors to incorporate the findings from renowned education theorists. We made a particular effort to draw from and implement Jean Piaget’s Zone of Proximal Development.
 
Piaget’s Zone of Proximal Development
Jean Piaget emphasizes the ​zone of proximal development​ (area labeled “learner can do with guidance”). It serves as a framework to understand the ideal difficulty of tasks that a learner should be engaged in. Some tasks are too easy, thus leaving the learners unchallenged. Other tasks might be too hard, making it impossible for the learner to grapple and disentangle the challenge. The zone of proximal development suggests that learners should ideally be presented with learning content somewhere in between, difficult enough to challenge the child but not overly difficult so that it ultimately becomes discouraging.
 

 
The MiaoKids system was designed with the zone of proximal development in mind. Our Wonder Math app presents your child with increasingly challenging problems tailored to their individual development. 
The exercises borrow from and build on the foundation of previous tasks to ensure a rich understanding through a process called scaffolding. Moreover helpful hints in the form of voice prompts and immediate feedback on correctness guide your child on their learning journey.
The MiaoKids ecosystem enriches your child’s cognitive development while being cost-effective. MiaoKids serves as a reliable companion to your child from toddler to grade school.
 

 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 

 
 

 

 

 
 
 
 

 
 

[1] Data derived from Council for Early Child Development (ref. Nash, 1997, Early Years Study, 1999, Shonkoff, 2000).
[2] Stagnitti, K., Bailey, A., Stevenson, E.H., Reynolds, E., & Kidd, E. (2015). An investigation into the effect of play-based instruction on the development of play skills and oral language. Journal of Early Childhood Research, 14(4), 389-406.

story:
SVQF's Work in Kenya:

The first of SVQF’s community development projects was located in Salabwek, a rural Kipsigi tribal community living in extreme poverty. In Salabwek, children were not given names until they reached the age of five because so many died before then and there was a 90% rate of adult illiteracy.

SVQF provided for the construction and furnishing of 8 one-classroom schools and teachers’ quarters, as well as numerous other community resources, such as safe water sources, latrines and a mobile health clinic. Drawn by the improved facilities and social services, people from neighboring communities migrated to Salabwek over the course of the 3-year project, expanding its population from the original 1200 to 5000 inhabitants.

President Bill Clinton, spoke about the successful model of SVQF at the 2008 Clinton Global Initiative Annual Meeting:

"[SVQF] partnered with the renowned child rights activist, Craig Kielburger and his organization, Free The Children, to adopt a village in the Masai Mara of Kenya. They’re going to provide several new schools and essential community services, including clean water [...] Again, this is a replicable model. So if you care about inequality and you don’t have a fortune to spend but you’d like to do something to change the reality of people’s lives on the ground, this is an example."   (http://svqf.org/president-bill-clinton-speaks-about-svqf/)

                                     

                                        SVQF's Work Today:

SVQF is partnered with the neighboring Masai village of Osenetoi. The community has about 2000 inhabitants and faces many challenges. 

Approximately 70% of the villagers live on less than $1 or $2 a day, and a third of the villagers are in debt stemming from school fees, the cost of livestock rearing, and loans taken to expand small businesses.

Additionally, there is an illiteracy rate of 80% for adult men and 90% for adult women. Approximately 20% of the village’s primary school-aged children do not attend school.

Help us replicate the successes of Salabwek!

 

                                            What We Need:

For every $10,000 we raise, we can build a fully-furnished classroom which will ensure a proper and healthy learning environment for Osenetoi's children.

      1. Cost of classroom construction: $8500

  • School-rooms in Kenya are made of a poured concrete foundation, a wood frame, cement bricks, and finished with a metal roof, glass windows and rain gutters.
  • All materials are procured locally and considered for their environmental sustainability as well as durability.  We locally source sand, stone bricks from a nearby quarry, wooden framework for holding the cement, iron rods for reinforcement bars, glass for windows and paint.

      2. Cost of classroom furnishing: $2500

  • Classrooms are outfitted with 20 desks/benches for 40 students, a blackboard, educational posters (teacher resources), a teacher desk and chair, as well as school supply kits.
  • School supply kits typically include a notebook, ruler, scissors, erasers, pencils, pencil sharpener, crayons or coloured pencils, coloured construction paper, tennis ball, and a cloth bag.
  • In additional to the classroom fixtures, we are able to source the required textbook materials needed for instruction at the primary school level for students through donations.

                                       For More Information:

                                                            www.SVQF.org

                                                 www.facebook.com/TheSVQF

 

FOR A TAX DEDUCTIBLE DONATION, PLEASE PAY THROUGH PayPal (available when you pay via IndieGoGo)

story:
NEWS: We’ve been thrilled to get so much support on our fun mission to rid the world from #STRESS. A big THANK YOU to all our backers and customers who supported our campaign thus far to make our product launch a reality! 

 

Made from quality polyester and acrylic fibers, our Belly-Rub Pups are designed to be fun, adorable, and cheeky personalities that encourage children and adults alike to laugh and de-stress, turning stressful moments into Belly-Rub Moments.

Each Belly-Rub Pup comes with its own individually designed high-wear microfiber bag with an official flock-printed logo, making them easy to carry safely everywhere, and available to fight stress away at any moment! Also included is a fun pocket guide to explain how to best use each pup in stressful moments - no prior experience or lengthy training necessary!

 

Stress can affect your life in almost every way. So it’s not only important to say NO! to stress, but it’s also healthy! Symptoms might manifest both mentally and physically including the following: 

 

 

There are so many Belly-Rub Moments in our daily lives where our pups can be your own plush personal heroes to keep stress away. Boss have you down? Kids being hassled at school? Tax season have you feeling the pressure?  Maybe you’re working too hard or you’re not working hard enough? 

Join our mission and make a statement that you want the world to de-stress! Let your Belly-Rub Pup be your superhero on the journey to defend against that stressful villain! 

Put your Belly-Rub Pup put on your desk to ward off stress and let everyone know you’re not about that life! You are Zen, you are calm, happy, and not giving in to tension. Make a statement for others to follow that creates a relaxing and playful environment everyone appreciates.

 

 

Okay, so Belly-Rub Pups aren’t a cure-all of stress or anxiety. They are plush toys after all. We fully advocate for getting help from a professional if you need it. What Belly-Rub Pups do is serve as a reminder and give you the courage to not give in to stress. 

 

Stress manifests differently in all of us and there are multiple strategies for combating it including physical exercise, meditation, deep breathing and even laughter. Belly-Rub Pups playfully educate on basic focusing techniques, deep breathing, and laughter for a fun and unique stress-relief method that may just work for you or stressed people around you.

 

Focus on the here and now: This is mindfulness the Belly-Rub Pup way. Giving your pup a good belly-rub will help you get your mind off whatever has been stressing you and lets you focus on the moment rather than being caught in spiraling thoughts. Mindfulness has been described as “a mental state achieved by focusing one’s awareness in the present moment, while calmly acknowledging and accepting one’s feelings, thoughts, and bodily sensations.”** 

 

 

 

Taking a few deep breaths at the same time will help you to relax even more. Deep breathing is one of the best ways to reduce tension and lower stress in the body. It increases oxygen to your brain, stimulating the parasympathetic nervous system and promoting a sense of calm.



 

And most importantly, have a good laugh: Laughter is a great form of stress relief, and that's no joke. When you start to laugh, it doesn't just lighten your load mentally, it actually induces positive physical changes in your body. 

 

Made for kids over 3 and adults of all ages, Belly-Rubs Pups have unique personalities and advocate particular ways of dealing with stress. Pick the pup you connect with the most and let stress know you’re a force to be reckoned with! 

What our customers say about our pups:

«I think they are useful for children because they appeal to a child's natural love for a stuffed friend. The method is easy and uncomplicated.» (Jackie)

«I think this is a great tool for teaching mindfulness and how to deal with stress! » (Dana M.)

 

With the support of our backers, we were able to produce our first batch of Belly-Rub Pups and are now ready to deliver our pups within 5 days of ordering through Indiegogo InDemand. Check out our pictures from our first batch production of NORMANs: 

 

 

Beat Wyss (CEO and spokesperson) & Gaby Wyss (Product design)

Beat Wyss is a start-up coach and entrepreneur. After more than 15 years as a marketing executive, Beat founded his own consulting company Awarenics LLC in 2017. Together with his wife, Gaby, they entered the start-up world with  ‘dogtalkz’, a next-generation wearable device for dogs. 

Gaby Wyss is a Board-certified veterinary Neurologist and has been working as a Neurologist in veterinary clinics over the last ten years. Passionate about horses, Gaby is an avid western rider and loves spending her spare-time with her two quarter horses.

When working as a specialist in the behavioral medicine department at the Veterinary Clinic of the University of Minnesota, Gaby experienced first hand, what an important role animals play for our emotional well-being and how powerful our four-pawed friends are in reducing stress. Gaby’s observations of the emotional bond between pets and their owners gave us the inspiration for BELLY-RUB PUPS: Stressed pet owners were just as much a concern as stressed pets and when stressful moments hit, their beloved pets were often not around to help them to relax.  

Awarenics, LLC was founded in 2017 with the vision of helping start-up companies achieve sustainable growth through early market testing, as well as the development of lifestyle products that consumers can emotionally relate to.  The company’s first products are Belly-Rub Pups, which were designed to bring a bit of fun and relaxation into people’s busy lives. Through these fun, loveable plushies, Awarenics hopes to bring as much joy to others as they had by creating them.

 

Disclaimer:

'Not for children under 3 years' BELLY-RUB PUPS do not provide medical advice and do not endorse any medical or professional service obtained through information provided on this site or any links to this site. The use of BELLY-RUB PUPS does not replace medical consultation with a qualified health or medical professional to meet the health and medical needs of you or others.

 

*WebMD.com

**mindfulness.org

story:
Short Summary

We want to thank everyone who helped us raise the money for Benjamin’s passport and airline ticket. You have made it possible for him to come home to his family, and have a chance at a good life. Although this is good news it has mixed feelings for Benjamin, Aaron and Yoel. They are brothers and have been looking out for each other since being placed in an orphanage. We never intended to separate them but if we didn’t get Benjamin here first, the judge would have rescinded the court order.

Now we have a new hurdle to overcome, we have to raise enough money to get the necessary paperwork started for Aaron and Joel, or they could be separated as well if one of them is adopted. Please help us keep them together so our family can be complete. All we ask is that you give what you can until we reach our goal. We need at least $5000.00 to get the ball rolling, adoptions are expensive and unless you are wealthy most people cannot afford it. During our last fund raiser on Indiegogo.com (http://igg.me/p/125421?a=724924) we compared the adoption fund raisers of Children opposed to animals. Sadly people give more to animals than Children who need a home, don’t get me wrong helping animals is honorable but helping children grow in a good family is even more rewarding.  Before you turn this away at least consider what a difference you will make in the life of a child who wants to come home and be with their brother.

God bless you

Angel & Angie Perez

What We Need & What You Get

We need you to help us reach our goal anything will help even a dollar

The Impact

Three boys will be united with a family that loves them

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our story or link, the more you share the more you help!

And that’s all there is to it.

Although this is good news it has mixed feelings for Benjamin, Aaron and Yoel. They are brothers and have been looking out for each other since being placed in an orphanage. We never intended to separate them but if we didn’t get Benjamin here first, the judge would have rescinded the court order.
Now we have a new hurdle to overcome, we have to raise enough money to get the necessary paperwork started for Aaron and Joel, or they could be separated as well if one of them is adopted. Please help us keep them together so our family can be complete. All we ask is that you give what you can until we reach our goal. We need at least $5000.00 to get the ball rolling, adoptions are expensive and unless you are wealthy most people cannot afford it. During our last fund raiser on Indiegogo.com (http://igg.me/p/125421?a=724924) we compared the adoption fund raisers of Children opposed to animals. Sadly people give more to animals than Children who need a home, don’t get me wrong helping animals is honorable but helping children grow in a good family is even more rewarding.  Before you turn this away at least consider what a difference you will make in the life of a child who wants to come home and be with their brother.
God bless you
Angel & Angie Perez


What We Need & What You Get
We need you to help us reach our goal anything will help even a dollar


The Impact
Three boys will be united with a family that loves them


Other Ways You Can Help
Share our story or link, the more you share the more you help!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Share Our Vision

We are opening a mindfulness based community center, in Lucedale Mississippi. We have been working very hard at remodeling the building, but we need your help.

We wish to offer opportunities for individuals and families to understand and utilize their unlimited potential through self expression, awareness and anything that keeps us moving, thinking and creating. We believe that life should be experianced and enjoyed moment to moment, and our goal is to provide a space where people can go to fill those moments with mindful, healthy, creative experiances. Please check out our facebook page and meet some of our instructors. We will be creating an art wall in our art room next week, where anyone who wants their art to be a part of the center can come and claim a piece of wall. We will also be creating a Gratitude Tree the following week, where our "thank yous" will hang like ornaments, to remind us of all we have to be thankful for. Both events will be posted on our facebook page. Please join us as we create our space!! https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Center-of-Infinite-Possibilities/331634450269337

WHAT IT WILL TAKE TO MAKE OUR DREAM POSSIBLE

The Center is scheduled to open in May of 2013. In order for this to happen, we will need the following:

  • Flooring
  • demolition of several walls
  • Fresh paint
  • Djembe drums for classes
  • meditation pillows, yoga mats
  • art supplies

The Impact

Our state has a reputation for obesity, teen pregnancy, alarming high school drop out rates and drug use. Our belief is that helping people recognize their worth through mindfulness and conscious creation, they can be empowered to take charge of their lives. The classes to be offered will be the following:

  • Mindfulness Meditation
  • Mindfulness classes adults and teens
  • Yoga - Adult & Teen
  •  Yoga - Kids
  • Tai-Chi - Adult*Family
  • Djembe drumming- adult*child
  • Kickboxing classes
  • Dance workshops
  • Zumba classes - adult and children
  • Theatre group w/ yearly performance
  • Various art classes- metal work, sculpting, stained glass, ect.
  • Art shows
  • Self-defense classes

The center will also have a food pantry for anyone in need.

 

 

Helping Hands

We understand that not everyone that shares our dream and has the desire to donate is able to in a financial form SO,

If you have a skill/trade you wish to provide as a donation please contact me via email thecenterforinfinitepossibilities@yahoo.com

  • Also, any donation of supplies needed would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for helping to make this a positive world, one community at a time.

story:
Summary

As stated in the description of the campaign. Since I can remember it has been my dream to create an industry changing video game!
 
I was born in Uruguay and moved to the states when I was about 2 years old, we stayed there until a life threatening disease of one of my parents forced us to move back to Uruguay. Apprently the Drs suggested my mom to go to Uruguay for this surgery, since they were specialized.
 
I've been back in Uruguay since 1994 and after quite a few attempts to receive formal programming education I have had to drop out due to family/life issues. Even though I was able to teach myself html and how to create websites, played around with Pascal and PHP, I was never confident enough to look for a job in that field.
 
Now I can say without a doubt in my mind that I have reached a point of my life where I just need to say, "that's enough".

So I will get my formal programming education in the USA, planing on starting at Lansing Community College next August.
 

What Do I need?

Unfortunatelly, in order for me to get a student's visa I need to have at least 20,000 USD for each year I will be studying in the USA.

For starters this adds up to 40,000 for a 2 year degree and will go up to close to 100,000 for a bachelor's degree.

I was trying to work towards that goal by myself, but in Uruguay's economy it's not something I can do in the near future. This is why I need your help! :)

I understand that a lot of people are pretty tight on money, just like myself, so if you cannot contribute please spread the word around, maybe someone you know can! :)
 
I am also welcome to ideas on other ways to fund my goal.
 
I will be updating this campaign as I have updates on working towards my goal. Every little bit helps!
