story:
This campaign seeks to fund Regina Nelson's presentation at the ICRS Conference in Baveno, Italy through "Theorist-at-Large" pre-order book sales.

REGINA NELSON is a Ph.D. student at Union Institute and University concentrating on Ethical and Creative Leadership studies and interdisciplinary research within the medical cannabis movement.  Her educational background
consists of undergraduate and graduate level Interdisciplinary degrees: a B.A.
from Vermont College (1998) and an M.L.S. in Leadership from the University of Oklahoma (2002).  In 2012, Ms. Nelson published her first peer-reviewed article, Framing Integral Leadership within the Medical Cannabis Community. She has also presented at peer-reviewed conferences hosted by the International Leadership Association and now the International Cannabinoid Research Society. Ms. Nelson is a Founding Officer of Cannabis Patient Network Institute (CPN Institute/CPNI), a patient-led and driven membership organization desiring to build awareness of the endocannabinoid system and cannabis’ use as medicine and champion of community-based research projects; as well, as Integral Education and Consulting, LLC with new and exciting educational projects launching in 2014.

Thank you for taking the time to consider funding this project!


Hello! 


Just as we were preparing to launch a crowd-funding project for my new book, “Theorist-at-Large: One Woman’s Ambiguous Journey into Medical Cannabis,” I’ve been offered an opportunity-- way too good for a nerd like me to pass up,
so I am hoping that with your help, both will transpire.

A few months back, certain that I would not be selected, I submitted an
abstract to present at the International Cannabinoid Research Society (ICRS)
2014 Symposium in Baveno, Italy.  Last week, I was shocked to learn that my abstract has been accepted to present a “poster presentation” and that I am the recipient of a $500 travel award (to be presented in Italy during the conference).  This may mark the acceptance of the first Leadership Scholar presenting at the ICRS Symposium, I’m not quite sure, but it’s unusual for a clinical conference to consider challenging methodologies for presentation seriously…
but I’ll take it. For it also allows me the opportunity to learn from and interact with Scientists and Researchers, like Raphael Mechoulam from Israel and so many others I’ve cited that my head is spinning a bit. I am truly honored, now I’d like your help making it happen. 

Below is my presentation abstract:

Integral Frames: Interdisciplinary Tools Supporting Cannabis Research
Regina Nelson, M.L.S., Ph.D.(s)

Union Institute & University, Cincinnati, OH, USA


The medical cannabis movement, an ongoing and current health care controversy, provides us with a rich vein of study and demonstrates the need for Integral approaches in public healthcare practices.  This presentation explores the suitability of Ken Wilber’s AQAL model as an Integral Frame to guide the development of healthcare practices that address the true needs of the citizens they are designed to support. Delving into narrative research, this
presentation demonstrates that when we come to understand the narratives of
patients, including their medical histories, we gain an understanding of how
socially, culturally, and politically failed drug policies and corresponding
healthcare practices impact not only the lives of cannabis patients, but of all
global citizens.  This knowledge supports the use of interdisciplinary methodologies, in addition to clinical trials, to help us gain a better understanding of cannabis and cannabinoid therapies, as well as the patients using these therapies.  This presenter suggests Integral approaches to healthcare build a collective capacity that support increased cannabis education and research, while impacting society positively on a large scale.

Keywords:  Cannabis, Research Method Development, Human/Clinical Research, Other


As you can see, this is outside the normal parameters for a symposium like the ICRS (http://www.icrs.co/SYMPOSIUM.2014/index.2.html).  My goal is the share the experience of cannabis patients with those who hold the research we depend on in their hands. 

What’s needed to make this happen:

$950 Registration Fee (Due by May 10th)

$1600-$2000 Airline Ticket (Need airline miles donated/purchase ASAP)
$1200 for hotel, other transportation, and expenses related to the presentation (The honorable Dr. David Ostrow has offered a shared accommodation that I am excited to accept).
So, in short, I’ll need more than $3000 to make this trip (including donated airline miles to offset the biggest expense—call if you have some to spare!). 
So how can you help me make this possible?

Well, that’s easy—fund the project! 

Any and all donations provide the funder with an annual membership to CPN Institute (www.CPNInstitute.org).  As CPNI grows, the member benefits will
continue to grow—our website is under construction and we’ll soon be opening an educational portal for members only, we’ve got a ton of educational events
coming up later this year, and several research projects with protocols about
ready to go!  All CPNI memberships directly support public education, research and community development activities.  Check out our 2013 Annual
Report on our website and see how far CPNI can stretch a dollar!  We made a lot of great things happen in 2013—and 2014 is no different, except we’re growing!! (www.CPNInstitute.org)  If you can’t spare a dime but still want to
help, email me about volunteering your time and skills:
reginanelson.cpn@gmail.com

Funding at $25 and above, will provide the funder with a First Edition copy of my first book, “Theorist-at-Large: One Woman’s Ambiguous Journey into Medical Cannabis” and for those contributing a $100 or more, a personally signed edition! (And, if it’s possible, I’ll hand-deliver it to you, if not—we’ll rely on the postal service—One or more boxes can also be slated for delivery to any bookstore, business, local event,….and Unionites, even Residency, for I plan to be there to finish my last term of courses, just as soon as I arrive back from Baveno, Italy!).

“Theorist-at-Large” is a compilation of articles submitted as final papers during my Ph.D. journey.  After being told on several occasions that I should consider publishing one or the other in an academic journal, and then experiencing what that is like when “Framing Integral Leadership in the Medical Cannabis Community” published in late 2012, well…a self-published book seemed
easier… though it hasn’t been exactly the Webster’s definition of ‘easy’!!

The book is currently in final proofreading and a cover is under design, the goal has always been to release this book in June of this year—considering the article that lead to the ICRS abstract is included, this seems to be a timely coupling.  $10 from each funded pre-order will be applied directly to publishing the book; the remainder, until we reach the $3000 goal will be applied to the ICRS Symposium in Baveno, Italy.  If we exceed our goal,
all funds will be applied to marketing and funding additional copies of the
book. (200 Pre-Sold Editions would exceed expectations!  Can you help make that possible?)

Finally, for those who desire to make my book and presentation dreams come true, as well invest in something for themselves, we are exclusively offering a signed “Federal IND Tin” from former federal IND patient, George McMahon.  During the time he was a federal cannabis patient in the Investigational New Drug Program (IND), George McMahon received one of these tins each month, complete with 300 "marijuana cigarettes."  Although many offered
money for empty tins, George refused to sell his while he remained a federal
patient.  In October he lost that right, and the first tin is donated to CPNI to kick-off this crowd-funding campaign!  This crowdfunder is an exclusive opportunity to own one signed by George! (valued at $1500-3000 and museum quality) Note: After our goals are met, additional tins may be purchased to support The McMahon's move to Colorado. Since October 2013, he has been without medicine and support in Iowa; his doctor retired and he was unable to find a physician to support the requirements of the IND program.  Therefore, he no longer receives federal medicine.  He and his wife seek refuge in Colorado—donations to help The McMahon’s can be made through CPN Institute.
Contact me for more information: reginanelson.cpn@gmail.com.

During the course of this Indiegogo project, we’ll be honoring all donations made via the PayPal Donation button on our website (www.CPNInstitute.org)
with the same perks! 


If you can’t contribute financially—we understand (trust me, we understand!), but you can support this project in many other ways even if you don’t have a dime!!
To start, HELP  CPNI, get the word out about this Campaign!!
You only have until May 23rd to support this campaign!!

Please share the link to this campaign with a personal message of support via email, facebook, google +, academia.edu, linkedin, or whatever social media you’re connected too! 


Please share your message of support every day!! (In every way possible!!) 
Share with your local newspaper!  Share with your favorite dispensary! 
Challenge your friends – family – and other patients to help!  Have a donation party and fund the proceeds before May 23rd!!  Share with
your local bookstore (ask them to place a large pre-order here or soon on
Amazon)!  Call or email me and see how else you might get involved and help!  reginanelson.cpn@gmail.com  Have another great original idea!!  Just Please Help! 

Thank you!!  XOXO

interdisciplinary methodologies, in addition to clinical trials, to help us gain a better understanding of cannabis and cannabinoid therapies, as well as the patients using these therapies.  This presenter suggests Integral approaches to healthcare build a collective capacity that support increased cannabis education and research, while impacting society positively on a large scale.Keywords:  Cannabis, Research Method Development, Human/Clinical Research, OtherAs you can see, this is outside the normal parameters for a symposium like the ICRS (http://www.icrs.co/SYMPOSIUM.2014/index.2.html).  My goal is the share the experience of cannabis patients with those who hold the research we depend on in their hands.  What’s needed to make this happen:$950 Registration Fee (Due by May 10th)$1600-$2000 Airline Ticket (Need airline miles donated/purchase ASAP)$1200 for hotel, other transportation, and expenses related to the presentation (The honorable Dr. David Ostrow has offered a shared accommodation that I am excited to accept).So, in short, I’ll need more than $3000 to make this trip (including donated airline miles to offset the biggest expense—call if you have some to spare!). So how can you help me make this possible?Well, that’s easy—fund the project!  Any and all donations provide the funder with an annual membership to CPN Institute (www.CPNInstitute.org).  As CPNI grows, the member benefits willcontinue to grow—our website is under construction and we’ll soon be opening an educational portal for members only, we’ve got a ton of educational eventscoming up later this year, and several research projects with protocols aboutready to go!  All CPNI memberships directly support public education, research and community development activities.  Check out our 2013 AnnualReport on our website and see how far CPNI can stretch a dollar!  We made a lot of great things happen in 2013—and 2014 is no different, except we’re growing!! (www.CPNInstitute.org)  If you can’t spare a dime but still want tohelp, email me about volunteering your time and skills:reginanelson.cpn@gmail.comFunding at $25 and above, will provide the funder with a First Edition copy of my first book, “Theorist-at-Large: One Woman’s Ambiguous Journey into Medical Cannabis” and for those contributing a $100 or more, a personally signed edition! (And, if it’s possible, I’ll hand-deliver it to you, if not—we’ll rely on the postal service—One or more boxes can also be slated for delivery to any bookstore, business, local event,….and Unionites, even Residency, for I plan to be there to finish my last term of courses, just as soon as I arrive back from Baveno, Italy!).“Theorist-at-Large” is a compilation of articles submitted as final papers during my Ph.D. journey.  After being told on several occasions that I should consider publishing one or the other in an academic journal, and then experiencing what that is like when “Framing Integral Leadership in the Medical Cannabis Community” published in late 2012, well…a self-published book seemedeasier… though it hasn’t been exactly the Webster’s definition of ‘easy’!! The book is currently in final proofreading and a cover is under design, the goal has always been to release this book in June of this year—considering the article that lead to the ICRS abstract is included, this seems to be a timely coupling.  $10 from each funded pre-order will be applied directly to publishing the book; the remainder, until we reach the $3000 goal will be applied to the ICRS Symposium in Baveno, Italy.  If we exceed our goal,all funds will be applied to marketing and funding additional copies of thebook. (200 Pre-Sold Editions would exceed expectations!  Can you help make that possible?)Finally, for those who desire to make my book and presentation dreams come true, as well invest in something for themselves, we are exclusively offering a signed “Federal IND Tin” from former federal IND patient, George McMahon.  During the time he was a federal cannabis patient in the Investigational New Drug Program (IND), George McMahon received one of these tins each month, complete with 300 "marijuana cigarettes."  Although many offeredmoney for empty tins, George refused to sell his while he remained a federalpatient.  In October he lost that right, and the first tin is donated to CPNI to kick-off this crowd-funding campaign!  This crowdfunder is an exclusive opportunity to own one signed by George! (valued at $1500-3000 and museum quality) Note: After our goals are met, additional tins may be purchased to support The McMahon's move to Colorado. Since October 2013, he has been without medicine and support in Iowa; his doctor retired and he was unable to find a physician to support the requirements of the IND program.  Therefore, he no longer receives federal medicine.  He and his wife seek refuge in Colorado—donations to help The McMahon’s can be made through CPN Institute.Contact me for more information: reginanelson.cpn@gmail.com.During the course of this Indiegogo project, we’ll be honoring all donations made via the PayPal Donation button on our website (www.CPNInstitute.org)with the same perks!  If you can’t contribute financially—we understand (trust me, we understand!), but you can support this project in many other ways even if you don’t have a dime!! To start, HELP  CPNI, get the word out about this Campaign!!You only have until May 23rd to support this campaign!!Please share the link to this campaign with a personal message of support via email, facebook, google +, academia.edu, linkedin, or whatever social media you’re connected too!  Please share your message of support every day!! (In every way possible!!) Share with your local newspaper!  Share with your favorite dispensary! Challenge your friends – family – and other patients to help!  Have a donation party and fund the proceeds before May 23rd!!  Share withyour local bookstore (ask them to place a large pre-order here or soon onAmazon)!  Call or email me and see how else you might get involved and help!  reginanelson.cpn@gmail.com  Have another great original idea!!  Just Please Help!  Thank you!!  XOXO

story:
For more than 30 years, The Jewish View has been a mainstay on community media television throughout the Capital Region. A Chicago native, Rabbi Nachman Simon of the Chabad House of Delmar started the program shortly after arriving in Albany from West Hartford, Conn. in 1987.

There have been several co-hosts throughout the years but since 2004, Marc Gronich has co-hosted. From 2014 to 2018, more than 450 half-hour uninterrupted programs have been taped and can be found on our new website, www.jewishviewtv.com.

The word “Jewish” in our title suggests honesty, truthfulness, balanced questions and open to all opinions of a nonsectarian and cultural nature. This is how we learn from the viewpoints of others, whether or not you agree with them. We maintain political and social ideas are important to the Jewish community and other ethnic groups as well. This program is intended to be educational, creating a basis for respectful dialogue.

Since our inception, the recording of The Jewish View has been stationed inside a fixed studio and harnessed to the whims of available time slots at two community media outlets. This has held us back from doing the type of program that can be a better fit for our audience.

For the past two years we have been retooling our efforts and searching for the proper equipment for us to take our show on the road, with a portable studio, in an effort to visit guests across the state and beyond.

As you will see from the promotional video prepared for your viewing, the program was taped using equipment that is no longer broadcast quality. You will notice the program does not properly fit the screen, it is a bit out of focus and the audio leaves a bit to be desired. All this will be fixed when we purchase new equipment.

In an effort to raise $50,000 we have set up this crowdfunding page to get the ball rolling so we can build a serious audience base that will be dedicated to watching important interviews with some light-hearted commentaries added to appeal to a broader audience and thereby develop repeat viewers.

By building an online audience where we can track demographics, we will be able to go to potential advertisers to have this program be self-sustaining, with your help. Your seed money will allow us to grow and blossom into a valued television program.

We are a non-profit 501(c)3 corporation. Your contribution will be tax-deductible. If you choose not to contribute via indiegogo.com, you will save us the 5% fee they charge and a 2% service fee from the credit card processor. You can mail your generous donation to 109 Elsmere Avenue, Delmar, NY  12054 with a check made payable to Friends of The Jewish View.

            In advance, thank you for your consideration and generous contribution.

Best regards,

 

Marc Gronich                                                                                                  Rabbi Nachman Simon

story:
Writing is an extremely powerful way to learn.

"Writer, poet, and memoirist Erin Jourdan helped to unleash all of our desires, wants, and all without shame."--Stella Cheung, student

"Thank you! You've inspired me today to pick up my writing again in a whole new way, something I've had in the back of my mind for a while now."--Kris Cahill 

Since receiving my MFA from San Francisco State University, I have created a teaching method focused on accessing personal truth and creativity. The eCourse includes prompts, lectures, readings and discussions that teach writers of any age, at any level. I believe writing is an amazing tool to help people learn about themselves, and communicate their own unique stories.

What needs to be done?

The funding from this fundraising effort will cover the design and programming involved with creating a downloadable eCourse. I have already created all of the writing modules and lesson plans. All that is left to finalize this project is designing the website, finding a way to integrate the materials and creating the videos. I am already half the way there, I just need the help to hire the professionals I need to bring this project online.

Why is this eCourse so important?

Most colleges charge a premium for creative writing instruction. In my research, online classes cost anywhere from $525 to $750, which is extremely expensive. I will be able to keep costs at a reasonable level so that more writers can have access.

For a $100 donation, funders will receive the e-book and entire e-course!

The chance to learn, on your schedule! 

With the proliferation of Khan Academy, many perceive that e-learning is the next frontier. I am focused on making this e-course easy to use, and using my skills as a marketer to share this project with everyone, around the world.

 

 

DONATE and get the eBook NOW! 

Beautifully designed and illustrated, this 15 page e-book is a course in stretching into what scares you. Fun to do by yourself, or with a group of friends.

 

 

 

Sample Website Page Mockups

My Philosophy

"When you consider something like death, after which (there being no news to the contrary) we may well go out like a candle flame, then it probably doesn't matter if we try to hard, are awkward sometimes, care for one another too deeply, are excessively curious about nature, are too open to experience, enjoy a nonstop expense of the senses in an effort to know life intimately and lovingly. It probably doesn't matter if, while trying to be modest and eager watchers of life's many spectacles, we sometimes look clumsy or get dirty or reveal our ignorance or say the wrong thing or light up with wonder like the children we all are." 
---Diane Ackerman

story:
Short Summary

Spoke 'n Revolutions Youth Cycling is a leadership program for high potential Youth from risk filled environments to pursue personal success, to prepare them for leadership roles in their community, work, and college while motivating them to be role models for others. 

What We Need & What You Get

The Underground Railroad tour of 2011 took 33 days and had us renting a 15 passenger van at the cost of over $3,000.00. On our summer tour of 2012 we plan to go even further adding additional rental fees and higher fuel costs as we head out west tracing The Bufallo Soldiers and Lewis & Clark routes. With your help in raising $8,000.00 we can purchase or put money down our own pre-owned van and use it for many tours to come. 

 

The Impact

Bringing history to life is the hook for the youth cyclists' involvement with Spoke 'n Revolutions. Having them project plan, design fundraising campaigns, advocate, volunteer and present to the community at-large is the fundamental leadership skills they develop that prepares them for a confident post high school life in college and beyond. The world will always need strong and confident leaders.

Resting on our laurels is not what we do here at SnR but the success of the UGRR tour of 2011 needs to be applauded by the shear effort and determination of the youth cyclists. Who learned of the many contributions of the enslaved and the free to change a nation. The kind and generous people encountered along the way that opened their hearts and homes will be forever etched in the hearts and minds of the SnR Cyclists.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can help us reach our goal in addition to making a pledge: Tell your friends about us and encourage them to invest in our future by investing in youth and our future leaders.

story:
Reach for the Stars is featured on BBC New Online:

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-17898331

Hear Christopher Phillips & Yunos Bakshi on BBC World Service Radio 'Science in Action' http://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/p00r2jtq/S...

 

Hear Mike Stone on BBC Radio 4's 'Material World': http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b01h77lj

 

Our Story

The night sky unites all of humanity. Its magnificent canopy has been a source of inspiration for all the peoples of Earth. Every culture has its own interpretation of the night sky, yet the language of the night sky is universal, connecting all the peoples of the world. It speaks to the very soul of every human. The night sky is a bridge between cultures and a source of inspiration that can change lives.

Reach for the Stars - Afghanistan is an Astronomers Without Borders project managed by Christopher Phillips in collaboration with the Afghanistan Astronomy Association, with additional education advice and documentary support from Imperative Space in the UK.

Reach for the Stars - Afghanistan is an educational, humanitarian project that will establish Afghanistan's first astronomy curriculum for young children set in the context of Afghan culture, Islamic astronomical heritage and modern science.

Reach for the Stars - Afghanistan will also help build peace by complimenting the students’ formal education, setting them on course for a brighter future.

Reach for the Stars – Afghanistan’s team includes science communicators, planetarium professionals, humanitarian activists, Afghan government officials, Afghan nationals and international media professionals.



Here’s how we will do it!

With the support of friends and sponsors worldwide, Reach for the Stars - Afghanistan will deliver educational resources to schools, orphanages and refugee camps in the Kabul area, and establish training and educational programs based on those materials.

We also aim to produce a documentary film telling our story to a broader audience, raising awareness and support.

Once established in Kabul, Reach for the Stars - Afghanistan aims to expand to the rest of Afghanistan, and then beyond across Asia, the Middle East and Africa.



1) Little Book of Stars

Little Book of Stars is an introductory astronomy text for young Afghan children authored by Christopher A Phillips, edited and illustrated by Dr. Sai Pathmanathan, and translated into Pashto by Mujtaba Ilmi.

Little Book of Stars covers astronomical topics from A-Z accompanied by cartoon illustrations. It will also serve as a complimentary text for children learning English.

With an initial print run of 1000, Little Book of Stars will be distributed free to Pashto-speaking children in Kabul.



2) Educational Materials

Many schools in Afghanistan lack even the most basic classroom materials.

Educational Kits containing pencils, pens, paper and astronomy education materials will be distributed, establishing the educational infrastructure for Reach for the Stars – Afghanistan to build upon.



3) Astronomy Curriculum Development

A basic astronomy curriculum – in Afghan cultural context and drawing upon the rich astronomical heritage of Islam – is being developed in collaboration with the Afghanistan Astronomical Association.

Activities include basic observational astronomy, solar observing, and fun classroom activities such as kinesthetic astronomy (a practical activity where students use their bodies to mimic the movements of celestial bodies).

Astronomical outreach will also be conducted with children in classrooms, orphanages and refugee camps around Kabul and in other major cities as the security situation permits.



4) Cultural Exchange Program

Kite flying is an important part of Afghan culture. Kite flying was banned until 2001 and is now enjoying a resurgence amongst the atmosphere of nation building.

Kite flying is also an important part of native Hawaiian culture.

Reach for the Stars – Afghanistan will deliver hand made kites constructed by Hawaiian schoolchildren on the Big Island of Hawai'i to their counterparts in schools in Kabul and beyond.

This important exchange, through shared cultural values and ideals, will connect the children of these two very different cultures, creating a sense of freedom for the Afghan children in their otherwise isolated environment.



5) Documentary: Reach for the Stars - Afghanistan



Reach for the Stars – Afghanistan will produce a documentary that follows Afghan children as they struggle to learn in an environment of violence and political upheaval. Female and Pashtun students will be highlighted as they fight inequality, poverty and conflict in their quest for education and the promise of a brighter future.



The Impact

Reach for the Stars - Afghanistan will change the lives of Afghan children. Inspiration, education and experiences early in life have the greatest impact on who we become. We will be reaching Afghan children at an important, and impressionable, time in their lives.

As a science communicator and educator, I see educational experiences inspiring young minds on a daily basis. I see lives changed, just as my life was changed years ago when I began to look at the night sky. The power of the night sky has changed countless lives.

It is my goal to bring that inspiration and life-changing experience to the least advantaged of children.

Astronomy can be a powerful tool. Expanding horizons to a universe filled with the incredible and sublime, astronomy allows us to explore our place in the universe, and our relationship with our planet, and with other people, our place in the universe. Astronomy can expand the mind, changing it forever. Some of civilization’s greatest minds have been inspired by the study of astronomy.

The Universe inspires us to look beyond the known, to ask questions, observe. It inspires us to shape our own destiny and future.

This journey begins with small steps – steps you can help the children of Afghanistan take.

Reach for the Stars - Afghanistan compliments existing formal education programs, setting children on a course for a life beyond the turmoil of conflict, and economic and social inequality.

YOU can be a part of this. YOU can make a difference.



Christopher A Phillips





What We Need & What You Get



We need your support. Costs for Reach for the Stars – Afghanistan include:

Printing, delivery and distribution of The Little Book of Stars.

Delivery and distribution of additional educational materials.

Travel to Kabul and accommodations for educational and logistics staff.

Reach for the Stars – Afghanistan will conducted by dedicated volunteer staff, distributing materials in Kabul and working with local schoolteachers without salaries - sometimes at great personal risk.

Educational programs will be developed and implemented by Christopher Phillips, in collaboration with the Astronomical Association of Afghanistan, again without compensation.

Reach for the Stars – Afghanistan is designed to achieve a high impact with the very modest funding goal of $20,000 USD.

The staff of Reach for the Stars – Afghanistan is determined to make this happen. You can help.



In return for your support you will have directly contributed to the reconstruction effort in Afghanistan. Your support will help us enrich and inspire young lives in a nation that is navigating its way out of an era of prolonged and devastating conflict.

Help us heal the wounds of over 30 years of war and strife.

We will ensure recognition of your funding efforts and support by entitling you to one of our 'stellar perks', dependent on level of funding.



Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Like us on Facebook, re-tweet us on Twitter, tell your friends and colleagues.

Help raise awareness for Reach for the Stars – Afghanistan to ensure its success.

We can't do it alone. Make a difference. Help us, and help the children of Kabul reach for the stars.

The staff of Reach for the Stars – Afghanistan is determined to make this happen. You can help.

In return for your support you will have directly contributed to the reconstruction effort in Afghanistan. Your support will help us enrich and inspire young lives in a nation that is navigating its way out of an era of prolonged and devastating conflict.
Help us heal the wounds of over 30 years of war and strife.
We will ensure recognition of your funding efforts and support by entitling you to one of our 'stellar perks', dependent on level of funding.

Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word! Like us on Facebook, re-tweet us on Twitter, tell your friends and colleagues.
Help raise awareness for Reach for the Stars – Afghanistan to ensure its success.
We can't do it alone. Make a difference. Help us, and help the children of Kabul reach for the stars.

story:
"The impact of sexual abuse stunts a child's developmental growth. It not only rapes them physically, it also rapes them psychologically.  Dare I say spiritually"? -  M. Britto, 2012

InLightenMe Books is about creating conscious books that are interactive, educational and fun.  In my experience as a social worker and mom, I found that I was not satisfied with some of the material I found at my finger tips. After much research and several client situations, I discovered  multiple topics that need to be accessible to both children and caregivers.  I realized after surveying many parents, caregivers, daycare centers & schools there was a lack of comfort, language  and expression for many topics that are becoming increasingly prevalent in our society. More children are acting out, being placed on medication, being violated at early ages and most importantly being dis-empowered. It is from this place of consciousness that the “What's Underneath our Tummy Tum” series was birthed.

"What's Underneath our Tummy Tum" is a series of three books for children ages two and up, and it is designed to appeal to parents as much as to their kids. It is intended as a guide for parents to have dialogue with their children about the power of their voice, name and self-awareness, all in a gentle and powerful way.  

The “What’s Underneath Our Tummy Tum?” series is about empowering children to identify their whole selves at an early age and promote full body awareness. This awareness is acknowledged in three series called “My Breath, My Beauty and My Body.”  It is a MIND, BODY & SPIRIT connection. It works from the inside out to assist children in creating healthy boundaries and having a voice and self- assurance at an early age. 

It fosters loving healthy communications about self-esteem building, self- regulation through the breath and the total body, not excluding the typically taboo parts, the parts “Underneath Their Tummy Tum”.

The "What's Underneath our Tummy Tum" series is broken down in the following way:

MY BREATH (Book 1) - utilizes breathing techniques and basic tai-chi to teach children how to self calm and self-sooth

MY BEAUTY (Book 2) - provides children with empowerment and the power of their voice and name

MY BODY (Book 3) - the most important book in the series, teaches children about safe people, their bodies and how to protect themselves

"What's Underneath our Tummy Tum"- the series:

My professional career has awarded me the opportunity to develop a deeper insight of how critical the early stages of development are to the Mind, Body & Spirit.

While there are several books available to our children for learning, my research showed that none explored the depth of language addressing the body in a way that children can understand, nor that provide parents with easy dialogue to have conversationally with children in a nurturing way.  Because children are curious about many things at an early age, this dialogue is organic and natural.  These books aide in identifying safe people, places, and boundaries in a way never explored before.  These books are colorful and interactive, and carefully designed using techniques I have learned during my professional career as a social worker. 

It is a know fact that:

  • Most parents/caregivers are unable to find books of this nature accessible to them
  • Most of these books can be found online, or in the court system after the abuse has taken place
  • Most children are spoken at and are underestimated as to their level of understanding important concepts

It has been my experience that many children who have experienced sexual trauma, and speak about it as older children, wish they had the ability to articulate it.  After hearing many of these stories, and after the birth of my own daughter, it became clear to me that something had to be done and that I needed to be proactive.  The concept for "What's Underneath our Tummy Tum" was birthed in the process.

The Illustrations:

 

One of the most important steps in writing this book was choosing the right artist to work with. The illustrations needed to tell the story, while engaging children in an educational way. After much searching, I discovered a talented artist, Caroline Artayudianto, who has created the cover art seen in this campaign. 

I have worked with the illustrator to bring you a sample of what is to come.  The bulk of the funding needed is required to complete all three books, and make copies available for distribution.

Here is what is needed (an estimate):

Illustrator: $4500

Printing & Publishing: $1,242.60 (for 100 books, each series) / $414.20 per book (24 pages color and B&W)

ISBN code:  $2,500 (for 100 books)

T-shirts: $1,620.00 (100 shirts)

  • Total Funds needed:  $9,862

What you will receive for your donations:

$10 – PEACE:  A personal thank you note from the author for your donation.

$25 – KINDNESS: A personal thank you note and an “InlightenMe Books” t-shirt.

$50 – JOY: A personal thank you note; a signed copy of the book; an “InlightenMe Books” t-shirt.

$100 – PROSPERITY: A personal thank you note; 2 signed copies of the book; an “InlightenMe Books” t-shirt.

$250 – GRATITUDE: A personal thank you note; 2 signed copies of the book; an “InlightenMe Books” t-shirt; a child drawing.

$500 – COMPASSION: A personal thank you note; 2 signed copies of the book; an “InlightenMe Books” t-shirt; a thank you mention in the book; and an invitation to a read aloud.

$1000 – LOVE:  A personal thank you note; 3 signed copies of the book; a signed illustration; a thank you mention in the book; an “InlightenMe Books” t-shirt; an invitation to a read aloud; and a child drawing.

*if the funding goal is not achieved, all proceeds will go towards illustrations and then we will regroup for a second round of funding needs.

Did you know?

  • There are over 70,000 "registered" sex offenders in the United States
  • 1 in 3 girls will be sexually abused by the age of 18
  • 1 in 5 boys will be sexually abused by the age of 18

But, only 1 in 10 of those victims will ever disclose that they have been sexually abused.  The average sex offender has over 114 victims in a lifetime, partly due to the low disclosure rate as indicated above.

  • 34% of child sexual abuse victims are abused by family members
  • 59% of child sexual abuse victims are abused by a friend and/or acquaintance
  • 93% of child sexual abuse victims know their attacker
  • 57% of convicted sex offenders report being sexually abused as a child
  • 1 in 5 children will come in contact with a sex offender on the internet through various social network sites

ABOUT THE AUTHOR

My name is Michelle Britto, and I am a Licensed Social Worker, with a Bachelor’s Degree in Psychology, Masters Degree in Social Work, a Degree in Occupational Studies.  I am also a License in Massage Therapist, and a mom.  I have worked in Preventive Services, Foster-Care and currently an employee of the Department of Education, working privately with both adult and children, as well as in healing centers in various boroughs in the state of New York.   I have also worked in psychiatric hospitals with children and adolescents utilizing breath work techniques.  And, have begun to use the theories and techniques outlined in the book, in summer and regular school curriculums.  What I have been able to see was that the need for this type of book is great.  At present, there are daycare centers, schools, parents, and recreation centers all around the world waiting for its release. 

Thank you, in advance, for the opportunity to bring this book to life.

Other Ways You Can Help

First and foremost, if you are excited and inspired by what we are doing, please forward, like, share, favorite and follow!!  These actions will have a huge impact in completing the What's Underneath our Tummy Tum series.

I thank you for helping to bring this book to life, for taking the time to explore the possibilities of “Self-Empowerment”, and the beauty of a child-like spirit being preserved for your child’s highest good.

©InLightenMe Books, 2012

story:
What is Pipe Dreams?

Remember when you were a kid and Super Mario always brightened up a rainy day?

Now imagine if you had no SNES, maybe your parents couldn't afford to buy you one, maybe you weren't well-behaved that year and Santa never made the drop.

Or perhaps you were born with a degenerative disease meaning most of your young life is spent in various hospital beds, not being quite old enough to understand what's going on.

Our aim is to create a charitable organisation aimed at improving the quality of life for children in difficult or emotionally challenging situations such as short or long term hospital stays and care homes.

To elaborate, we all know what a fantastic job our healthcare professionals do in looking after children with physical and mental disabilities, but they can only do so much. In the current economic climate funding for all public sectors is stretched thin, and while focus is moved on to the important things such as medicine and healthcare, it can often be easy to forget what children need most in times of need. Play.

Pipe Dreams aims to raise funds to buy toys, video games, consoles and more to donate to children in situations that would usually make them scared, paranoid and frightened in a bid to help them have the fun every child deserves. We will be primarily targetting gamers, running events for people of all ages such as video game tournaments to be held in local bars, sponsored gaming sessions (Most levels of Meat Boy without dying anyone?), colouring competitions for the young 'uns and more. In addition to this, we have the help of a budding graphic artist lending their hand to a range of attractive merchandise such as tshirts, pin badges and wrist bands amongst other things. A minimal amount of all money raised will be used towards advertising and covering the costs of the events themselves, but we pledge to donate a minimum of 70% of all funds raised directly to our cause. 

In order to acheive this, we pledge to operate in an entirely transparent manner. A full list of all our ins-and-outs will be available on our website from the word go, helping those donating to see exactly what fun things their donation helped to purchase, and where those things were sent. 

 

So how will my donation help?

Primarily, the funds we raise through this site will go towards our cause. We aim to spend the bulk of the funds buying toys, games, books, arts & craft supplies and more for children in vulnurable and distressing situations. As well as this, though, we want to make sure we can continue doing good things in the future.

When the inspiration to help children in these difficult and distressing situations first moved us to take action, we had the idea to hold some fundraising events, raise awareness and anything else it took to do what we could. If only it were that simple. 

As we have a very specific goal in mind, it means a lot to myself and the wonderful people who have pledged their time to help that the money we raise is used in a way we agree with rather than disappearing in production costs and salaries. This involves firstly registering ourselves as a non-profit organisation. Secondly, in order to reach out to a larger audience we require a dedicated online presence. After this, our fundraising ventures will need, amongst other things, advertising and prizes. Eventually we hope to have all our events be self-sustaining, with each fundraiser being enough to help our chosen cause and to fund the next event. Initially, however, startup costs are required and much as we are more than willing to offer our time, we're not a financially blessed bunch... 

Your donations will help with the up-front costs required to help us get this off the ground. Funds will be used to ensure we have a professional online presence, uniforms for our voulenteers, merchandise to provide as a reward for donations, advertising and up-front costs for our first major event and other various costs.

 

What about the future?

At present we're committed to ensuring Pipe Dreams becomes a respected and well-known charitible organisation in the Torbay area, but this isn't all. Once we become fully established in the South West we aim to branch out to other nearby cities such as Plymouth and Exeter, finding like-minded individuals to run events of their own under the Pipe Dreams banner to benifit hospitals and care homes in their area. The more people we can find to help, the bigger difference we can make!

 

I'm a local business owner, what can I do?

A lot! As with anything of this nature, awareness is key. We can only make a difference if we spread our message to as many people as possible, and for that aim we need to become a recognised organisation in our local area. You can help by allowing us window space for posters, letting us place a collection jar on the counter, lending us your fine drinking establishment for a fundraising event or anything else you can think of, no matter how small. Every little helps, and we will be eternally grateful to anyone who can help us.

 

I'm broke... But I want to help!

We appreciate better than anyone (trust us...) that sometimes times are hard and while you may want to help, it might not be possible. In that case, all we ask is that you spread awareness of our campaign and help us to reach as many people as possible. As with any crowd-funding venture we are at the mercy of the people we can make aware of what we're trying to do. Share our page on facebook, throw us a tweet, even just text your friends and let them know of what we're trying to do!

 

What if you don't meet your goals?

While we really hope we do, if for any reason we don't meet our funding goal we may unfortunately be unable to provide any goods related to perks. Depending on the amount raised we will do our best with what we have, and if it turns out it's not enough all funds will be donated to charitible causes.

story:
Our Story

I have been selected to attend The Junior Statesmen Summer School at Princeton University in July. This enrichment program is open to 250 high school students from across the nations who are interested in politics and government. It is an honor to be selected for the Summer School, and I am excited to attend. I am writing to ask for your financial support to help me attend.


The Impact

At the Summer School, I will be taking college level courses with distinguished university professors. We will also have an opportunity to meet and question major political leaders. 


What We Need & What You Get

The funding will go to helping me get to Summer School and paying for the materials needed while I'm there. For those who donate I will be providing you with a journal of my experiences while I'm there. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to know more about the program please visit www.jsa.org.

story:
My name is Tanner. I'm 9 years old and in the Third Grade.  I'm raising money for my school Walk-A-Thon. Last year my brother Jake sent everyone that donated a video of me and our other brother Cody giving him a Pie-in-the-Face (see YouTube video below). This year it's my turn! If you donate I will let my brothers give me a Gatorade bath and I will send you the video for your veiwing pleasure!!

2013 THIRD STREET WALKATHON IS HERE!

The 2012 Walk-A-Thon is on Friday, March 15th.  This is a great exercise-oriented event that involves students, teachers, parents, and friends and family for one great cause: raising money for Friends of Third Street programs.   The Walkathon is the focus of the PTA's Health Week and takes place during school hours and allows Third Street kids to have a field day while raising money for Third Street.  

Events include: walking the track, basketball shooting, cup stacking, tug-of-war, and others.  There will be a 2:30 PM assembly after the Walkathon and students and teachers will be receiving great prizes.  This is an assembly you don't want to miss.

Last year, the Walk-A-Thon raised nearly $35,000 and my brother Jake was the top fundraiser at over $3000. I am trying to beat that number this year.  Please support me and my school. The money will help fund much needed programs that the public school system has cut the past few years, including arts, athletics, library hours  and more.  Your donation will be 100% used for school based programs.

 

Thank you,

Tanner

3rd Grader

Third Street School - Los Angeles, CA

 

MORE ABOUT THIRD STREET SCHOOL:

Third Street Elementary School is consistently proving, even in the face of current State and District budget cuts, that a public school education can still produce well-rounded, top-scoring students who will continue on to higher education and become distinguished leaders of tomorrow. Third Street students’ Academic Performance Index (API) is 948, placing the school in the top 2% of all public elementary schools in Los Angeles.

Third Street School receives absolutely no Title 1 funding due to the fact that fewer than 20% of our students qualify for the free- and reduced-lunch program.  This means that Third Street School receives approximately $350,000 LESS FUNDING per year than a comparably-sized Title 1 school in the district.  It is up to us to fill this gap and keep our school competitive. Please join us and support the efforts of our students: 
 
 
Friends of Third is a 501(c)3 non-profit booster group organization that supports Third Street Elementary with curricular enrichment and classroom support programs.
 
  
At Third Street Elementary, parents and students team together on a number of initiatives to show how THIRD STREET SCHOOL IS A CASE STUDY FOR PUBLIC EDUCATION THAT WORKS!

I am trying to beat that number this year.  Please support me and my school. The money will help fund much needed programs that the public school system has cut the past few years, including arts, athletics, library hours  and more.  Your donation will be 100% used for school based programs.
 
Thank you,
Tanner
3rd Grader
Third Street School - Los Angeles, CA
 
MORE ABOUT THIRD STREET SCHOOL:

Third Street Elementary School is consistently proving, even in the face of current State and District budget cuts, that a public school education can still produce well-rounded, top-scoring students who will continue on to higher education and become distinguished leaders of tomorrow. Third Street students’ Academic Performance Index (API) is 948, placing the school in the top 2% of all public elementary schools in Los Angeles.Third Street School receives absolutely no Title 1 funding due to the fact that fewer than 20% of our students qualify for the free- and reduced-lunch program.  This means that Third Street School receives approximately $350,000 LESS FUNDING per year than a comparably-sized Title 1 school in the district.  It is up to us to fill this gap and keep our school competitive. Please join us and support the efforts of our students: 

 




 

Friends of Third is a 501(c)3 non-profit booster group organization that supports Third Street Elementary with curricular enrichment and classroom support programs.
 

 




At Third Street Elementary, parents and students team together on a number of initiatives to show how THIRD STREET SCHOOL IS A CASE STUDY FOR PUBLIC EDUCATION THAT WORKS!

story:
Who are we and what are we about:

The Okita Project encompasses the ambitions of three college students; Nick, Joe, and Kevin, to help communities in the developing world get access to necessities of life.  These include vaccinations from diseases, sustainable methods of producing energy, and, of course, clean drinking water. The disparity in global income and quality of life from the "first world" to the "third world" is alarming and not always obvious to those who do not stop to think about it. Thus, we aim to create some pause in your day to contemplate giving to our worthy cause. 

Needs and gifts:

We need start up cash so we can begin this endeavor. The funding that we will receive will go allow us to file for with the IRS, the state of New Jersey, pay for any legal fees, and help us register and maintain a website.  The remaining funds will go to larger fund raising projects and materials to begin our work. What we offer in return are some awesome mechandise to show your support, all of which have been produced ethically, without slave labor and in the United States.

Why:

Our leadership team includes majors from a wide range of humanity disciplines, such as Philosophy and Political Science, in conjunction with Business, Economics, and scientific fields such as Psychology and Physics. Through these avenues we have become aware of several issues plaguing the overall development of humanity throughout the world. Our goal is to bring a fresh take on problems, such as contamination in water supplies, and hopefully make strides toward solving them.

Looking to help in some other way?

Here on indiegogo we are really trying to get the start up cash to get our operation moving forward.  If you want to show help us out please pass this around to anyone and everyone who you think would be interested in helping our cause.

story:
We are Jim, Sara, Scott, and Stephanie, four professional classical music performers and teachers who are passionate about music education and inspired by the El Sistema movement.

About Us

Jim Legge is principal violist of the Saskatoon Symphony and has a large teaching studio.  He has played and taught in Saskatoon for 17 years.

Sara Spigott grew up in Outlook, SK and studied oboe at the University of Saskatchewan, University of Ottawa, San Francisco Conservatory of Music and the Glenn Gould School in Toronto.  She is a freelance musician and is also a music and band teacher currently working for Saskatoon Public Schools.

Scott McKnight has been an active performer and teacher in Saskatoon since moving from Ontario in 2010.  He studied cello performance at the University of Ottawa and Wilfrid Laurier University.  He recently completed his Suzuki Training and keeps busy with his teaching studio.

Stephanie Unverricht grew up in Saskatoon and recently moved back to play principal bassoon with the Saskatoon Symphony.  She teaches several instruments around Saskatoon and surrounding communities, and plays and sings in Minor Matter, a local indie-folk band.

Our Program

Currently we are going into Vincent Massey Community School one day a week to work with two classes of children aged 7-9.  Our goal is to expand into a program that runs five days a week after school.

We will start with 40 kids, each with their own string instrument.  Playing in an orchestra teaches the importance of teamwork in a non-competitive environment.  Learning an instrument and playing as part of an orchestra teaches children to be well rounded, confident citizens in our community.  This type of opportunity is not readily available for most of these students.

What We Need

We were recently awarded a grant on the condition that we match its funding. This means that every dollar raised with this campaign turns into two!
Whether we match, exceed, or fall short of our goal, this money will be used towards the purchase of 40 child-sized instruments.

The Impact

Originating in Venezuela in 1975, Sistema-inspired programs have been created across the world.  In the past 4 years programs have started up in Canadian cities including Winnipeg, Moncton, Saint John, Ottawa, Toronto and Vancouver.  We believe Saskatoon is in need of a Sistema program, and children in grades 2-4 don't have many opportunities for extracurricular activities.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have a gently used child-sized violin or cello please consider giving it another chance to be played by one of the kids in our program.

We are always looking for volunteers to help.  If you have any valuable skills you’d like to share please let us know.

Please share this campaign with anyone you think may be interested in helping us out.  Spread the word!

story:
My name is Katie Ridenour. I am a 26-year-old Turkish linguist with the United States Air Force. I am originally from Elkhart, Indiana--a factory town, basically--from a lower-middle class family.

I was determined to go to college when I graduated high school--because the majority of my family struggles with alcoholism, drugs and abuse. I wanted to rise above that. So I went to college on my own dime, taking out extensive student loans to do so and working while I was in school. I worked every summer and right after graduation, I worked two jobs to keep afloat. 

My project concerns these student loans. I am being crushed under their weight. I couldn't afford to go to grad school when I finally managed to graduate from college, so I joined the US Air Force. There, I've learned many things--and I had hoped to make it a career. However, I was recently diagnosed with Lupus--an autoimmune disorder where the body attacks itself. Due to this and to a PTSD diagnosis, I'm going to be discharged in a matter of months. 

 

Almost all my money goes to my student loans, which add up to a combined total of about $75,000. Here, I just want to start with my smallest loan--hoping to work my way up. This site gave me a spark of hope. 

 

I have dusted myself off and gotten up and kept trying over and over again and I've spent a lot of teary, sleepless nights wondering what I am going to do. Thinking about how I'm ever going to rise above the hardships that my family deals with, above the station that I've been fighting my whole life. My student loans are so much and I can't afford grad school--so that I could actually qualify for a job in my field. I can't stay in the military and once the Lupus progresses, things will only get more difficult. 

 

With you, I ask for a helping hand. I want to pay off these loans so I can study abroad, so I can look into raising money for Lupus research and so that I can help fund others on this site. I want to give back but I need help. 

 

I would appreciate anything and everything. Every little bit helps. And if you can't--I completely understand. I've been there. I've been here. And I've been here for a long time. But please, please--maybe consider sharing this. Spreading the word. Please help me to help others.

 

Thank you so much for your time.

Katie Ridenour

story:
Short Summary

In 2009, I was diagnosed with Thyroid Cancer and subsequently lost my marriage within a year later. My daughter was born in the midst of all of this. Since then I have had to essentially retrain myself into viewing life in a different aspect. What I thought success meant, what I thought life was about had changed. After going through my treatment I started to see how God was using me in my broken state to touch and help others. I began to see how 36 lives had been changed just merely on the fact that I was open to share my story and lend a helping hand while I expected nothing in return.

 

Currently I am registered and recieving training to because a Strategic Intervention Coach through the Robbins Madanes Training institute. My goal is to use these skills to further my abilities to reach others and change lives. I do not seek sympathy, but I know when I must be humble enough to understand when a little assistance is needed. Rest assured, whether I receive funding help or not, I will continue on and find a way. I sincerely believe that if you have a dream and a purpose, a way will be made, one way or another.

What We Need & What You Get

My goal for the funding is going completely to pay for the certification training. No funds will be used for any other purpose.

The Impact

This will enable me to reach more people in need. Those who do not know how to turn their tragedies into victories. To give cancer survivors, divorced individuals, married couples and those lost. To guide people through the rough waters of life and empower them with the skills they need to not just merely push through their tragedy. But to transform their way of thinking so that they can live a life of fullfilment. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren't able to contribute, if you would please forward this link on to others who you think may be able to. Also any prayers or words of encouragement are also greatly appreciated.

Regardless of what happens from here on out, I thank you for taking the time to view this page. And if nothing else is done, please go out and help someone who needs it. Our society needs more people like these.

 

 

Also, please be on the look out for my book that I will be writing soon, detailing my journey from the cancer, divorce and how I began to change my perception of life and chase a life long purpose that I feel I was designed for.

 

God Bless and live your life, Give others the hope of life :)

story:
Hello! 

My name is Emily McMillen and I am a 3rd teacher at Peabody Elementary, a Title 1 school in the middle of Memphis, TN. Throughout my early elementary years I struggled constantly with reading--but it was my 3rd grade teacher who cracked the code, who identified my dyslexia and got me the help that I needed in order to be successful throughout the rest of my life! 

Now, this cause has gotten even more personal for me, for I have one very sweet and bright little girl in my classroom currently who is struggling herself with dyslexia, and is in need of the best possible help so that she too can succeed to her fullest ability!

But this isn't just for my classroom--there are brilliant, creative, wonderful children across our nation who are struggling to be understood, struggling academically...kids that need our help! 

In bringing "The Big Picture" to Memphis, TN not only will we be raising awareness surrounding different learning styles, but we'll be partnering with professionals, experts, specialists, and educators across the nation so that we can help ALL children learn and succeed! 

What We Need From You

We need the funding to purchase the film rights and pay for a screening venue in order to bring this magnificent event to Memphis, TN! Your contributions will also allow us to hold this screening at Studio on the Square, a public theather in the midtown neighborhood of Memphis! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We also need you to get the word out and make some noise about the film screening, how to best teach dyslexics, and (ultimately) how to help ALL our kids learn! 

 Thank you! THANK YOU for all of your amazing help and support! 

For questions or more ways to get involved feel free to contact me at elmcmillen@gmail.com 

 
 
Save the Date: 
"The Big Picture" Dyslexia Film
April 20
Studio on the Square
9:30am show
Check out the trailer here!

story:
Flight4All! Let The children experience flight for free!

Firs of all let me introduce myself: I am a 21 ys old University student with the passion for flying. I am a licensed private pilot, and I also want to fly for a living. (You can see some videos of me flying at this url: http://www.youtube.com/user/baldomito)

Growing up It was hard to keep the motivation high, since the costs and the accessibility to flying for children and teenagers in Europe are close to none. 

I was fortunate enough to achieve my dream with scolarships, a part time job and the help of my parents, but I still see many dreams crushed to pieces! And many people giving up on flying without even a chance to try it!

Too many in my opinion! That why I want to share my love for flying with other people, (especially children) providing free trial flights across Europe.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what we need:

  1. An Aircraft! (Yes!): we need a second-hand 2 seater light airplane to do the job!
  2. Hangar and travel expenses (including fuel and maintenance for up to 100 jolly flights)
  3. All the money to start running the project! 
  4. A unique livery!

As a unique perk we will write your name on the plane, or you can have that AND you can enjoy a ride on the plane free of charge! You can also decide to name the plane yourself! Be an active part of a dream! 

The Big Picture!

The project is set to start locally (Italy). but the final goal is to make contact with children associations, foster homes, schools and even hospitals all across Europe to get even more children to experience fly!

NOTE: In case the funding goal is not reached the total amout will be given to the ground-breaking Stem Cell research by Dt. Vannoni (more info here http://www.staminafoundation.org). I am not affiliated in any way with this organization, i just believe in their work in curing children pathologies.

story:
Hello! 

My name is Umar Momen and I am a Junior at York high school in Monterey, CA. During the winter of 2012, My family and I went to Bangladesh and I was given the chance to visit two BRAC slum schools. It was an incredibly moving experience. Children younger than me who had grown up in harsh conditions with impoverished parents earning pennies a day wanted to grow up to bring change to their community. The encounter left me inspired to help out those young children and help them acheve their dreams, and so I began this campaign. An article on my experience can be read here.

Every contribution makes a massive impact on the lives of the students. It takes a mere $36 to fund a child for a full year. The education they recieve is comparable to or even better than that offered by the public school system and can completely alter a poverty-stricken child's future. Every dollar counts.

What is BRAC?

Since the country’s independence in the 1970s, Bangladesh has been plagued with poverty. In 1972, BRAC was founded as a non-profit organization with the goal of empowering the impoverished and providing them with the opportunity to change their lives. Since its foundation, it has mushroomed from a small, local foundation to a large scale operation aiding over an estimated 135 million people.

"No one else at home can read or write. I'm the only one who can."

Those are the words of 11-year-old Sabina Yasmin. Thanks to donations from people like you, she was able to recieve a decent education regardless of the fact that she was growing up in one of the poorest areas of Bangladesh. 

BRAC has been working since its inauguration to provide education to the most poverty-stricken slums and villages in Bangladesh. Bangladeshi slums are dirty, smelly, run-down communities where the poorest of the poor make their living. People wear simple, often worn out clothing and gutters overflowing with trash and waste line the streets. It is in places like these where BRAC is a saving grace, providing the children growing up in these harsh conditions with a chance at a proper education. 

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign aims to raise $5000 to send at least 130 primary or pre-primary age children from poor families to a BRAC school for one year. Upon completion of their time in a BRAC school, the children will transition into government-run schools. Children who come from the BRAC schools have been shown to do significantly better than children from regular schools. 

The money will be distributed to the areas where it is most needed in Bangladesh, and I will report back to you so you know how your money is changing lives.

Upon donating, you become a part of the BRAC movement and will recieve photos of your gift's impact. If you donate $35, then you know that a child half-way around the globe has a chance at making his or her dreams come true entirely thanks to you!

If you decide to donate and you are employed, check with your company to see if you can get a matching gift for your donation. An estimated $10 billion dollars of match funding is left unused every year. In this way, every dollar you donate becomes multiple dollars which can be put towards this good cause.

The Impact

Because of your donations, children who can only imagine going to a school can finally have that chance. Each school holds between 25 to 30 students, and $5,000 has the potential to open as many as five schools. In addition, new teachers can be trained and more equipment can be brought into the schools to enhance the education provided in the schools.

BRAC has already helped thousands of children build for themselves a better future, and with your donations, thousands more are soon to come. 

For more information on how to help, please visit www.brac.net.

People wear simple, often worn out clothing and gutters overflowing with trash and waste line the streets. It is in places like these where BRAC is a saving grace, providing the children growing up in these harsh conditions with a chance at a proper education. 


What We Need & What You Get
This campaign aims to raise $5000 to send at least 130 primary or pre-primary age children from poor families to a BRAC school for one year. Upon completion of their time in a BRAC school, the children will transition into government-run schools. Children who come from the BRAC schools have been shown to do significantly better than children from regular schools. 
The money will be distributed to the areas where it is most needed in Bangladesh, and I will report back to you so you know how your money is changing lives.
Upon donating, you become a part of the BRAC movement and will recieve photos of your gift's impact. If you donate $35, then you know that a child half-way around the globe has a chance at making his or her dreams come true entirely thanks to you!
If you decide to donate and you are employed, check with your company to see if you can get a matching gift for your donation. An estimated $10 billion dollars of match funding is left unused every year. In this way, every dollar you donate becomes multiple dollars which can be put towards this good cause.


The Impact
Because of your donations, children who can only imagine going to a school can finally have that chance. Each school holds between 25 to 30 students, and $5,000 has the potential to open as many as five schools. In addition, new teachers can be trained and more equipment can be brought into the schools to enhance the education provided in the schools.
BRAC has already helped thousands of children build for themselves a better future, and with your donations, thousands more are soon to come. 


For more information on how to help, please visit www.brac.net.

story:
Short Summary

I am a senior undergraduate student attending Rollins College in Winter Park, Florida, with plans to attend graduate school. As part of my preparation, I’ve researched grad programs, taken extra classes, and begun research in the field of biopsychology. One of the key skills I hope to learn through research is to present to a professional convention about studies completed. Prior to co-presenting with my mentoring professor, I would like to attend the annual meeting of AChemS to learn how the meetings run and what is expected of presenters, as well as learn from every presenter that offers his or her knowledge to the conference. 

AChemS meets once a year,  and its location changes each time. This year, I am fortunate to live within a 4-hour drive from the meeting, which will be held in Bonita Springs, FL. While this means I can drive rather than fly, it does not mean it will be affordable for a college student -- especially one who works two minimum wage jobs.

What We Need & What You Get

Not only will I need to spend time and money on travel, I will need to stay in the convention hotel, buy most of my own food, and keep a stash of emergency money in case of accident or other need. This is in addition to the cost of registration and attendance of the conference itself. Combine that with taxes, and the entire event will easily cost me over $1000 -- not something I have lying around.

  • Registration: $150
  • 3 nights in convention hotel: $900
  • Food/drink: $200
  • Gasoline: $80
  • Emergency funds: $200
  • Offset Indiegogo fees: $70
  • Total: $1600
ANY EXTRA? If I somehow go beyond my fundraising goal, extra funds will be allocated for me to take summer science classes. If I get more than that, I will use those funds to support me while I do research for free (for the experience!) over the summer. :]

The Impact

Attending this meeting is a wonderful opportunity for me to grow as a student and as a budding scientist. I will be able to listen to experts in the field about their work on the chemical senses (taste and smell), be exposed to the most recent research available, and even meet some of these researchers -- many of whom are instructors in graduate programs I plan to apply to.

Now that you’re familiar with the situation, I’d also like to add the following:

This would be the FIRST professional convention I have EVER gone to! I am super excited at the idea of going, and I cannot possibly wait to meet all the people that will be there! My professor is going, so I will know at least one person, and many of his friends and colleagues will also be there. Plus, I get to learn even MORE SCIENCE! I am over the moon with the idea that I FINALLY know what I want to do “when I grow up,” and I can hardly wait for this opportunity!

As my roomie put it: “This is YOUR DREAM!” Well, it may not be the entire dream, but it’s certainly a big step toward realizing it! :D

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot donate, please share this campaign:

  • Link people!
  • Email people!
  • Use the share tools here!

Thanks for your time and help!
